column3: Baddies Inbound

column2: Steiner forces are planning an assault to recapture the Annihilators. We need to hold this facility until the second Annihilator is ready.
column3: Steiner forces are planning an assault to recapture the Annihilators. We need to hold this facility until the second Annihilator is ready.

column2: Smooth Criminal IV
column3: Smooth Criminal IV

column2: Commander, we need to take out the House Steiner Anti-Aircraft base.
column3: Commander, we need to take out the House Steiner Anti-Aircraft base.

column2: Before we get there, however, you'll need to intercept the Steiner lance closing on our position.
column3: Before we get there, however, you'll need to intercept the Steiner lance closing on our position.

column2: We'll have some backup in the form of defensive turrets, but they won't last long against actual 'Mechs. You'll need to make sure to keep the enemy's attention, or they'll destroy the friendly facility.
column3: We'll have some backup in the form of defensive turrets, but they won't last long against actual 'Mechs. You'll need to make sure to keep the enemy's attention, or they'll destroy the friendly facility.

column2: The only way to stop the attacks entirely is to break their command and control -- which means taking down that enemy facility. That should be your priority.
column3: The only way to stop the attacks entirely is to break their command and control -- which means taking down that enemy facility. That should be your priority.

column2: I'll be on station, Commander. Once that base is rubble, I'll meet you at this LZ.
column3: I'll be on station, Commander. Once that base is rubble, I'll meet you at this LZ.

column2: That's it; let's pack it up, folks. Commander, we'll debrief back in orbit.
column3: That's it; let's pack it up, folks. Commander, we'll debrief back in orbit.

column2: Boom! Good kill, boss!
column3: Boom! Good kill, boss!

column2: Meyer, cut the chatter and get ready for the pickup.
column3: Meyer, cut the chatter and get ready for the pickup.

column2: Commander, we've completed all the primary objectives and you're clear to extract.
column3: Commander, we've completed all the primary objectives and you're clear to extract.

column2: I'm on station to pick you up here whenever you're ready, boss.
column3: I'm on station to pick you up here whenever you're ready, boss.

column2: As long as you're still in the AO, Commander, you'll need to keep the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} base secure.
column3: As long as you're still in the AO, Commander, you'll need to keep the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} base secure.

column2: Uh, Commander, I'm not seeing any more blips out there. I think you killed everything.
column3: Uh, Commander, I'm not seeing any more blips out there. I think you killed everything.

column2: Well, that's one way to protect a facility. Commander, there's a {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} lance ready to relieve you.
column3: Well, that's one way to protect a facility. Commander, there's a {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} lance ready to relieve you.

column2: When you're ready to extract, Sumire will pick you up at this location.
column3: When you're ready to extract, Sumire will pick you up at this location.

column2: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!
column3: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!

column2: We'll have to destroy that lance if we want to complete the mission.
column3: We'll have to destroy that lance if we want to complete the mission.

column2: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!
column3: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!

column2: If we destroy them we'll get a hefty bonus.
column3: If we destroy them we'll get a hefty bonus.

column2: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.
column3: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.

column2: Our employer is saying we NEED to kill those units. Prepare to engage.
column3: Our employer is saying we NEED to kill those units. Prepare to engage.

column2: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.
column3: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.

column2: If we decide to kill these units our employer if offering a bonus.
column3: If we decide to kill these units our employer if offering a bonus.

column2: Incoming {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} DropShip!
column3: Incoming {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} DropShip!

column2: Our employer wants us to kill these guys. This mission isn't ending until they die.
column3: Our employer wants us to kill these guys. This mission isn't ending until they die.

column2: Incoming {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} DropShip!
column3: Incoming {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} DropShip!

column2: Our employer is offering us some extra cash if we destroy these units too.
column3: Our employer is offering us some extra cash if we destroy these units too.

column2: Scratch another target.
column3: Scratch another target.

column2: Well, that didn't go as planned. Let's debrief back on the Argo, Commander.
column3: Well, that didn't go as planned. Let's debrief back on the Argo, Commander.

column2: Good job, commander. All primary objectives complete. Get to evac, Sumire will pick you up here.
column3: Good job, commander. All primary objectives complete. Get to evac, Sumire will pick you up here.

column2: Shit. Commander, a Steiner Leopard just dropped another lance into the AO.
column3: Shit. Commander, a Steiner Leopard just dropped another lance into the AO.

column2: They seem fairly determined to hold this facility. We need to hurry before even more of them show up.
column3: They seem fairly determined to hold this facility. We need to hurry before even more of them show up.

column2: Boss, that's another Steiner lance in the field. Getting kinda crowded down there.
column3: Boss, that's another Steiner lance in the field. Getting kinda crowded down there.

column2: Well, the good news is that I don't see any more inbound DropShips... the bad news is that's another enemy lance.
column3: Well, the good news is that I don't see any more inbound DropShips... the bad news is that's another enemy lance.

column2: Commander, more hostiles are entering the area. I've marked their LZ.
column3: Commander, more hostiles are entering the area. I've marked their LZ.

column2: Commander, more hostiles are entering the area. I've marked their LZ.
column3: Commander, more hostiles are entering the area. I've marked their LZ.

column2: Commander, we've got an enemy lance moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} base.
column3: Commander, we've got an enemy lance moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} base.

column2: Commander, we've got an enemy lance moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} base.
column3: Commander, we've got an enemy lance moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} base.

column2: Commander, Steiner reinforcements are inbound to this location.
column3: Commander, Steiner reinforcements are inbound to this location.

column2: Commander, Steiner reinforcements are inbound to this location.
column3: Commander, Steiner reinforcements are inbound to this location.

column2: There's those base defenses, Commander. Looks like the Steiner forces got the base's turrets powered up.
column3: There's those base defenses, Commander. Looks like the Steiner forces got the base's turrets powered up.

column2: Commander, Steiner reinforcements are inbound to this location.
column3: Commander, Steiner reinforcements are inbound to this location.

column2: The {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} has provided some of their own forces to support us.
column3: The {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} has provided some of their own forces to support us.

column2: They're here to defend their base and will engage any hostiles that get too close.
column3: They're here to defend their base and will engage any hostiles that get too close.

column2: Commander, the employer's base is under attack! Our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} allies will stay close to the base to defend it.
column3: Commander, the employer's base is under attack! Our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} allies will stay close to the base to defend it.

column2: Commander, I'm seeing hostile defenders surrounding the enemy base.
column3: Commander, I'm seeing hostile defenders surrounding the enemy base.

column2: We can't complete the contract until those units are destroyed.
column3: We can't complete the contract until those units are destroyed.

column2: Commander, they've got units spread out around the target facility. If we clean them out, our employers won't have to; they're offering a bonus. It's your call.

column2: The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. It upgrades the 'Mech with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in place of the autocannons and removes the medium lasers for four Hovertec Streak SRM-2 launchers, two each in the left and right sides of the torso. One ton of ammo for the launchers is kept in the left torso while the standard heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03
column3: The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. It upgrades the 'Mech with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in place of the autocannons and removes the medium lasers for four Hovertec Streak SRM-2 launchers, two each in the left and right sides of the torso. One ton of ammo for the launchers is kept in the left torso while the standard heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks. Склонность: Extended Torso Twist Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.03

column2: The UrbanMech IIC is a Clan IIC-style upgrade of the original UrbanMech. Around the same time as the development of the OmniMech during the Golden Century, Clan Coyote technicians reworked this venerable design. They studied battle data from as far back as the Amaris Civil War and used this research as the basis for their upgrades. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03
column3: The UrbanMech IIC is a Clan IIC-style upgrade of the original UrbanMech. column2: The product of an aborted series of experiments into LAM technology, the Urbanmech LAM is not surprisingly; poorly suited for either role. Designed by the self proclaimed professor of Cluffs Stand, Mencius Horvat; using a mixture of stolen Urbanmech parts and Lostech recovered from throughout the Periphery. Slow by LAM standards and drastically under gunned by Urbanmech standards, this mech struggles to fill either role. That said, the shock factor of an Urbanmech LAM deployed against uninformed opponents, has allowed it a measure of success when used as a raider. Dual ER Mediums and a bevy of rockets provide a nasty punch at close quarters, but prove mediocre at longer ranges. The only known examples of this mech were were recovered by the DMI and were turned over to the NAIS, though their current status is unknown. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
column3: The product of an aborted series of experiments into LAM technology, the Urbanmech LAM is not surprisingly; poorly suited for either role. column2: Designed by Cataclysm, a former Freeborn Clan Wolf MechWarrior turned Mercenary, and infamous UrbanMech fanatic, this refit is designed to be a cost-effective and logistically reliable way to garrison cities. column2: Double Agent
column3: Double Agent

column2: Okay, Commander. I've set you down just outside the Davion base's assumed sensor range. With any luck, you'll have a little breathing room to plan your approach before everything goes to hell.
column3: Okay, Commander. I've set you down just outside the Davion base's assumed sensor range. With any luck, you'll have a little breathing room to plan your approach before everything goes to hell.

column2: Thank you, Meyer. Commander, I'd recommend exercising caution on this deployment. If this facility is valuable enough to attract the attention of the Taurians and the Capellans, it's probably gonna be well defended.
column3: Thank you, Meyer. Commander, I'd recommend exercising caution on this deployment. If this facility is valuable enough to attract the attention of the Taurians and the Capellans, it's probably gonna be well defended.

column2: Odds are good. But hey, heavier defenses mean better salvage.
column3: Odds are good. But hey, heavier defenses mean better salvage.

column2: The base is ours, but we've got a problem. The Argo is picking up an encrypted comm signal emanating from the structure. Judging by the length and frequency of the transmissions, I think it's safe to say that it's some sort of distress beacon.
column3: The base is ours, but we've got a problem. The Argo is picking up an encrypted comm signal emanating from the structure. Judging by the length and frequency of the transmissions, I think it's safe to say that it's some sort of distress beacon.

column2: That could complicate matters. The last thing we need is a Davion reinforcement lance swooping down on us before we can make the handoff. Dr. Murad, I need you to find a way to terminate that broadcast.
column3: That could complicate matters. The last thing we need is a Davion reinforcement lance swooping down on us before we can make the handoff. Dr. Murad, I need you to find a way to terminate that broadcast.

column2: Roger that, XO. I'll get a team on it right away.
column3: Roger that, XO. I'll get a team on it right away.

column2: If House Liao and the Taurians both want this base, they're gonna have to find someone else to get it for 'em. We're calling this one.
column3: If House Liao and the Taurians both want this base, they're gonna have to find someone else to get it for 'em. We're calling this one.

column2: Bogeys on sensors!
column3: Bogeys on sensors!

column2: [GENERIC VO] Area is not clear, Commander. Eliminate the hostiles before continuing to the next Objective.
column3: [GENERIC VO] Area is not clear, Commander. Eliminate the hostiles before continuing to the next Objective.

column2: [GENERIC VO] Sensors are clear, proceed to the next objective.
column3: [GENERIC VO] Sensors are clear, proceed to the next objective.

column2: DropShip inbound, Commander! Prep for incoming!
column3: DropShip inbound, Commander! Prep for incoming!

column2: Scanner's picking up defensive turrets, Commander. Big ones.
column3: Scanner's picking up defensive turrets, Commander. Big ones.

column2: It's always something.
column3: It's always something.

column2: This is it—the forward base that our clients are so eager to take over. Doesn't look like much, does it?
column3: This is it—the forward base that our clients are so eager to take over. Doesn't look like much, does it?

column2: They usually don't. Still, I think that the XO has the right idea. We don't know what they're gonna bring online to defend this place.
column3: They usually don't. Still, I think that the XO has the right idea. We don't know what they're gonna bring online to defend this place.

column2: This is the contract that Lady Marina wanted us to take, Commander. It seems fairly straightforward.
column3: This is the contract that Lady Marina wanted us to take, Commander. It seems fairly straightforward.

column3: The objective to scout the base that is being captured. Must be completed before the actual capture of the base.

column3: Scout the Davion Forward Base

column2: The Federated Suns have constructed a forward base in the no-man's-land between their territory and ours on Flintoft's northern continent. We need you to eliminate their garrison and capture that base. We will remit payment when you've completed the job and secured the base.
column3: The Federated Suns have constructed a forward base in the no-man's-land between their territory and ours on Flintoft's northern continent. We need you to eliminate their garrison and capture that base. We will remit payment when you've completed the job and secured the base.

column2: Double Agent II
column3: Double Agent II

column2: All right, Commander. If our Capellan friends are to be believed, at least two groups of hostiles should be just ahead of you. They're as likely to shoot at one another as they are to shoot at you, so I imagine the situation's about to get a little chaotic down there.
column3: All right, Commander. If our Capellan friends are to be believed, at least two groups of hostiles should be just ahead of you. They're as likely to shoot at one another as they are to shoot at you, so I imagine the situation's about to get a little chaotic down there.

column2: I'll take chaos over concentrated fire any day. Plus, Lady Marina said that she's got reinforcements en route to help us. So… go team, I guess?
column3: I'll take chaos over concentrated fire any day. Plus, Lady Marina said that she's got reinforcements en route to help us. So… go team, I guess?

column2: That's the idea, Yang. Commander, you know how this goes: meet up with our reinforcements, take out all the bad guys, and get to the evac zone. Sumire will fetch you when the AO is clear.
column3: That's the idea, Yang. Commander, you know how this goes: meet up with our reinforcements, take out all the bad guys, and get to the evac zone. Sumire will fetch you when the AO is clear.

column2: Well done, Commander. A Maskirovka detachment has already taken possession of the prison and extracted the captive MIM agent. All in all, this was a clean, efficient operation—just the kind I like.
column3: Well done, Commander. A Maskirovka detachment has already taken possession of the prison and extracted the captive MIM agent. All in all, this was a clean, efficient operation—just the kind I like.

column2: Remember that when you cut us our check. And, uh, if it wouldn't be too much trouble… maybe ask your Maskirovka pals to take it easy on that prisoner. She's already been through a lot.
column3: Remember that when you cut us our check. And, uh, if it wouldn't be too much trouble… maybe ask your Maskirovka pals to take it easy on that prisoner. She's already been through a lot.

column2: I don't control the Maskirovka, Mr. Virtanen. But I'll see what I can do.
column3: I don't control the Maskirovka, Mr. Virtanen. But I'll see what I can do.

column2: Primary targets destroyed Commander.
column3: Primary targets destroyed Commander.

column2: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.
column3: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.

column2: That Taurian DropShip I told you about has set down 'Mechs, and they're moving on your position with purpose.
column3: That Taurian DropShip I told you about has set down 'Mechs, and they're moving on your position with purpose.

column2: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} lance has arrived!
column3: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} lance has arrived!

column2: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.
column3: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.

column2: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.
column3: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.

column2: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.
column3: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.
column3: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.

column2: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.
column3: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.
column3: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.
column3: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.
column3: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column2: This job ain't worth dyin' for, Boss. Let the Great Houses and the Taurians fight it out among themselves—we need to cut and run.
column3: This job ain't worth dyin' for, Boss. Let the Great Houses and the Taurians fight it out among themselves—we need to cut and run.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.
column3: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column2: We've received your message, and Maskirovka agents are on their way to take possession of the facility. Be advised that our long-range sensors have detected Davion and Taurian military DropShips en route to an AO near your position. To better protect the facility, we suggest that you engage them there. We'll supply you with reinforcements of our own as soon as we can.
column3: We've received your message, and Maskirovka agents are on their way to take possession of the facility. Be advised that our long-range sensors have detected Davion and Taurian military DropShips en route to an AO near your position. To better protect the facility, we suggest that you engage them there. We'll supply you with reinforcements of our own as soon as we can.

column2: Double Agent II
column3: Double Agent II

column2: All right, Commander. If our Taurian friends are to be believed, at least two groups of hostiles should be just ahead of you. They're as likely to shoot at one another as they are to shoot at you, so I imagine the situation's about to get a little chaotic down there.
column3: All right, Commander. If our Taurian friends are to be believed, at least two groups of hostiles should be just ahead of you. They're as likely to shoot at one another as they are to shoot at you, so I imagine the situation's about to get a little chaotic down there.

column2: I'll take chaos over concentrated fire any day. Plus, the Taurians are supposed to have reinforcements en route to help us. So… go team, I guess?
column3: I'll take chaos over concentrated fire any day. Plus, the Taurians are supposed to have reinforcements en route to help us. So… go team, I guess?

column2: That's the idea, Yang. Commander, you know how this goes: meet up with our reinforcements, take out all the bad guys, and get to the evac zone. Sumire will fetch you when the AO is clear.
column3: That's the idea, Yang. Commander, you know how this goes: meet up with our reinforcements, take out all the bad guys, and get to the evac zone. Sumire will fetch you when the AO is clear.

column2: Well done, Commander. TMI operatives have already taken possession of the prison and extracted the captive MIM agent. We're especially pleased that you resisted House Liao's attempts to turn you against us. Not many mercenary companies would.
column3: Well done, Commander. TMI operatives have already taken possession of the prison and extracted the captive MIM agent. We're especially pleased that you resisted House Liao's attempts to turn you against us. Not many mercenary companies would.

column2: Our contract was with you. When we sign a binding agreement, we adhere to it, no matter what the Successor States say.
column3: Our contract was with you. When we sign a binding agreement, we adhere to it, no matter what the Successor States say.

column2: I'll remember that. We'll resolve this when you return to orbit. Marisol-Chaplin out.
column3: I'll remember that. We'll resolve this when you return to orbit. Marisol-Chaplin out.

column2: Primary targets destroyed Commander.
column3: Primary targets destroyed Commander.

column2: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.
column3: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.

column2: That Capellan DropShip I told you about has set down 'Mechs, and they're moving on your position with purpose.
column3: That Capellan DropShip I told you about has set down 'Mechs, and they're moving on your position with purpose.

column2: We've received your message, and TMI agents are on their way to take possession of the facility. Be advised that our long-range sensors have detected Davion and Liao military DropShips en route to an AO near your position. To better protect the facility, we suggest that you engage them there. We'll supply you with reinforcements of our own as soon as we can.
column3: We've received your message, and TMI agents are on their way to take possession of the facility. Be advised that our long-range sensors have detected Davion and Liao military DropShips en route to an AO near your position. To better protect the facility, we suggest that you engage them there. We'll supply you with reinforcements of our own as soon as we can.

column2: Double Agent II
column3: Double Agent II

column2: All right, Commander. If our Canopian friends are to be believed, at least two groups of hostiles should be just ahead of you. They're as likely to shoot at one another as they are to shoot at you, so I imagine the situation's about to get a little chaotic down there.
column3: All right, Commander. If our Canopian friends are to be believed, at least two groups of hostiles should be just ahead of you. They're as likely to shoot at one another as they are to shoot at you, so I imagine the situation's about to get a little chaotic down there.

column2: I'll take chaos over concentrated fire any day. Plus, the Magistracy is supposed to have reinforcements en route to help us. So… go team, I guess?
column3: I'll take chaos over concentrated fire any day. Plus, the Magistracy is supposed to have reinforcements en route to help us. So… go team, I guess?

column2: That's the idea, Yang. Commander, you know how this goes: meet up with our reinforcements, take out all the bad guys, and get to the evac zone. Sumire will fetch you when the AO is clear.
column3: That's the idea, Yang. Commander, you know how this goes: meet up with our reinforcements, take out all the bad guys, and get to the evac zone. Sumire will fetch you when the AO is clear.

column2: Well done, Commander. MIM operatives have already medevaced their incapacitated colleague away from the DMI interrogation facility. On a personal level, thank you for reaching out to us. The safe recovery of our agent is supremely important to us, and the information she's gathered could give us a decisive edge in future military engagements.
column3: Well done, Commander. MIM operatives have already medevaced their incapacitated colleague away from the DMI interrogation facility. On a personal level, thank you for reaching out to us. The safe recovery of our agent is supremely important to us, and the information she's gathered could give us a decisive edge in future military engagements.

column2: We're happy we could help, Lady Centrella. It was the right thing to do.
column3: We're happy we could help, Lady Centrella. It was the right thing to do.

column2: Yes, it was, and I thank you. Return to orbit, and we'll discuss the matter of your payment. Ana Maria Centrella out.
column3: Yes, it was, and I thank you. Return to orbit, and we'll discuss the matter of your payment. Ana Maria Centrella out.

column2: Primary targets destroyed Commander.
column3: Primary targets destroyed Commander.

column2: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.
column3: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.

column2: That Capellan DropShip I told you about has set down 'Mechs, and they're moving on your position with purpose.
column3: That Capellan DropShip I told you about has set down 'Mechs, and they're moving on your position with purpose.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.
column3: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.

column2: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.
column3: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.
column3: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column3: This job ain't worth dyin' for, Boss. Let the Great Houses and the Taurians fight it out among themselves—we need to cut and run.

column2: Ana Maria Centrella sends her regards, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Looks like you could use a hand out here.

column2: Roger that, Lance Leader. Good to have you on board.

column2: We're taking losses, Oliveira. At this rate, we might not be around to help you much longer.

column2: Copy that, lance leader. We'll do our best to keep you covered.

column2: We've received your message, and MIM operatives are on their way to reclaim our wounded agent. Be advised that our long-range sensors have detected Taurian and Liao military DropShips en route to an AO near your position. To better protect our agent, we suggest that you engage them there, away from the facility. We'll supply you with reinforcements of our own as soon as we can.
column3: We've received your message, and MIM operatives are on their way to reclaim our wounded agent. Be advised that our long-range sensors have detected Taurian and Liao military DropShips en route to an AO near your position. To better protect our agent, we suggest that you engage them there, away from the facility. We'll supply you with reinforcements of our own as soon as we can.

column2:
Darius pulls up beside you in a hurry. "Commander you have to come to the Command Center. You're not going to believe it. We're on C.B.S"

Darius smiles as you both make your way to the Command Center. 

"This is a C.B.S. Breaking News Alert...The Capellan Confederation has extended an open bounty to five mercenary companies to hunt down and eliminate a rogue company of the Wolf's Dragoons for war crimes against the Confederation. The companies named by our exclusive source are Broadsword Legion, Gray's Ghosts, Lone Star Regiment, The Knights of Caerbannog  and {COMPANY.CompanyName}. The amount of the bounty has not been disclosed. But is reportedly very large."

Darius turns to you and asks. "So {COMMANDER.FirstName}, are we going wolf hunting?"
column3:
Darius pulls up beside you in a hurry. "Commander you have to come to the Command Center. You're not going to believe it. We're on C.B.S"

Darius smiles as you both make your way to the Command Center. 

"This is a C.B.S. Breaking News Alert...The Capellan Confederation has extended an open bounty to five mercenary companies to hunt down and eliminate a rogue company of the Wolf's Dragoons for war crimes against the Confederation. The companies named by our exclusive source are Broadsword Legion, Gray's Ghosts, Lone Star Regiment, The Knights of Caerbannog and {COMPANY.CompanyName}. The amount of the bounty has not been disclosed. But is reportedly very large."

Darius turns to you and asks. "So {COMMANDER.FirstName}, are we going wolf hunting?"

column2: Breaking News
column3: Breaking News

column2: The company is going wolf hunting.
column3: The company is going wolf hunting.

column2: Task Darius with finding more about the contract.
column3: Task Darius with finding more about the contract.

column2: Darius provides an update. \"I was able to get the details of the contract Commander.\"\r\n\r\nHe hesitates for a moment. \"That Wolf's Dragoons company was pulling garrison duty on Repulse when their commander snapped. No one knows exactly why, either. But after the dust settled. They'd wiped out the entire settlement down to the last man, woman, and child. Needless to say, the Cappies are anxious or payback. They tracked the outfit to the planet Dicon. Which is where we'll need to head for the contract, Commander.\"
column3:
Darius provides an update. "I was able to get the details of the contract Commander."

He hesitates for a moment. "That Wolf's Dragoons company was pulling garrison duty on Repulse when their commander snapped. No one knows exactly why, either. But after the dust settled. They'd wiped out the entire settlement down to the last man, woman, and child. Needless to say, the Cappies are anxious or payback. They tracked the outfit to the planet Dicon. Which is where we'll need to head for the contract, Commander."

column2: Darius reaches out to get the details of the contract.
column3: Darius reaches out to get the details of the contract.

column2: Tell Darius not to worry about looking into the contract.
column3: Tell Darius not to worry about looking into the contract.

column2: Pass on the contract opportunity.
column3: Pass on the contract opportunity.

column2: Darius nods, and makes the order.\r\n\r\n\"Alright Commander I understand. We won't be getting our 15 minutes of fame on C.B.S. It's a shame. I think I'd look good on Holo-Vid.\"He says with a chuckle.
column3:
Darius nods, and makes the order.

"Alright Commander I understand. We won't be getting our 15 minutes of fame on C.B.S. It's a shame. I think I'd look good on Holo-Vid."He says with a chuckle.

column2: Darius stands down from looking into the contract.

column2: All units stand by; I'm opening the comms. Attention, Corina Luthendorff. This is Lady Suiko Nakano, Matriarch of House Nakano and former Tai-i of the 177th Yorii Lancers. I will not allow your foul stench to pollute my ancestral home. Prepare to die.
column3: All units stand by; I'm opening the comms. Attention, Corina Luthendorff. This is Lady Suiko Nakano, Matriarch of House Nakano and former Tai-i of the 177th Yorii Lancers. I will not allow your foul stench to pollute my ancestral home. Prepare to die.

column2: Lady Suiko, your daughter warned me that you might be \"visiting.\" Please, we're not enemies. Surely we can come to a mutually beneficial arrangement.
column3: Lady Suiko, your daughter warned me that you might be "visiting." Please, we're not enemies. Surely we can come to a mutually beneficial arrangement.

column2: You may have seduced my daughter with your money, pig, but my loyalties can't be bought.
column3: You may have seduced my daughter with your money, pig, but my loyalties can't be bought.

column2: Mom… don't do this. Please, you're going to get yourself killed. Or you're going to kill the one person who can save us from bankruptcy.

column2: Understood Lance leader, glad to have you with us.

column2: Luthendorff will not escape death again, Commander. Don't expect an easy fight. This time she'll be prepared for us. I'm picking up multiple heavy contacts on my sensors. More scrap for Luthendorff's funeral pyre.

column2: A House Divided II
column3: A House Divided II

column2: So, Commander, you've proven that your word means nothing. No matter. My comrades are hardened veterans, the embodiment of discipline and loyalty.
column3: So, Commander, you've proven that your word means nothing. No matter. My comrades are hardened veterans, the embodiment of discipline and loyalty.

column2: This is just business, Lady Suiko. We don't want to hurt you or your old war buddies, but this is your last chance to turn around.
column3: This is just business, Lady Suiko. We don't want to hurt you or your old war buddies, but this is your last chance to turn around.

column2: As long as Luthendorff threatens to taint our home and House Nakano's legacy, then she must die—along with anyone who gets in my way.
column3: As long as Luthendorff threatens to taint our home and House Nakano's legacy, then she must die—along with anyone who gets in my way.

column2: You know, if you win, your family's gonna end up on the streets, right?
column3: You know, if you win, your family's gonna end up on the streets, right?

column2: Did I not make myself clear? Poverty is a small price to pay to retain our honor.
column3: Did I not make myself clear? Poverty is a small price to pay to retain our honor.

column2: Not that I expect you to understand. Your only loyalty is to your bank account. Kill the comms.
column3: Not that I expect you to understand. Your only loyalty is to your bank account. Kill the comms.

column2: You've ensured that House Nakano is condemned to a lifetime of shame… I wish you had just killed me, Commander.
column3: You've ensured that House Nakano is condemned to a lifetime of shame… I wish you had just killed me, Commander.

column2: I'm sorry, but our house has the means to survive now. We'll weather any bad PR and move forward. Thank you, Commander. I'll remit payment.
column3: I'm sorry, but our house has the means to survive now. We'll weather any bad PR and move forward. Thank you, Commander. I'll remit payment.

column2: You're no better than a stray dog, mercenary—loyal only to the last hand that fed you. Disgusting.
column3: You're no better than a stray dog, mercenary—loyal only to the last hand that fed you. Disgusting.

column2: We're in position! All engineers have disembarked from the personnel carriers. The APCs will scatter and support you. Keep the turrets online, and we'll keep firing.
column3: We're in position! All engineers have disembarked from the personnel carriers. The APCs will scatter and support you. Keep the turrets online, and we'll keep firing.

column2: Warning commander, sensors are reading multiple contacts approaching from multiple vectors. Looks like the attacking force has brought reinforcements.
column3: Warning commander, sensors are reading multiple contacts approaching from multiple vectors. Looks like the attacking force has brought reinforcements.

column2: Be advised, some of the target buildings are sustaining damage. Your mission is to keep them standing.
column3: Be advised, some of the target buildings are sustaining damage. Your mission is to keep them standing.

column2: Commander, a target building has been demolished. Ensure the integrity of the remaining buildings.
column3: Commander, a target building has been demolished. Ensure the integrity of the remaining buildings.

column2: We're close. Luthendorff is holed up in the last building. Bury her in the rubble!
column3: We're close. Luthendorff is holed up in the last building. Bury her in the rubble!

column2: Mercenary Commander, we've received word of the assault on your position. Reinforcements are incoming, they are about halfway there. Maintain position and you will be relieved and reinforced shortly.
column3: Mercenary Commander, we've received word of the assault on your position. Reinforcements are incoming, they are about halfway there. Maintain position and you will be relieved and reinforced shortly.

column3: They have point defenses set up around the base. However, they're offline.

column2: We have a friendly convoy of engineers eager to get at those defenses and bring them online.
column3: We have a friendly convoy of engineers eager to get at those defenses and bring them online.

column2: Escort them safely to the generators, and we can boost our defensive capability with those turrets activated. Good luck!
column3: Escort them safely to the generators, and we can boost our defensive capability with those turrets activated. Good luck!

column2: Well, let's see if we can hold off Lady Suiko's geriatric MechWarriors.
column3: Well, let's see if we can hold off Lady Suiko's geriatric MechWarriors.

column3: Baddies Inbound

column2: Lady Suiko is inbound, and she's not alone. Her old war buddies are moving in fast-two lances of 'em. Keep in mind, we've got one goal: stop her from killing Luthendorff.
column3: Lady Suiko is inbound, and she's not alone. Her old war buddies are moving in fast-two lances of 'em. Keep in mind, we've got one goal: stop her from killing Luthendorff.

column2: The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. It upgrades the 'Mech with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in place of the autocannons and removes the medium lasers for four Hovertec Streak SRM-2 launchers, two each in the left and right sides of the torso. One ton of ammo for the launchers is kept in the left torso while the standard heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03
column3: The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. It upgrades the 'Mech with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in place of the autocannons and removes the medium lasers for four Hovertec Streak SRM-2 launchers, two each in the left and right sides of the torso. One ton of ammo for the launchers is kept in the left torso while the standard heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks. Склонность: Extended Torso Twist Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.03

column2: The UrbanMech IIC is a Clan IIC-style upgrade of the original UrbanMech. Around the same time as the development of the OmniMech during the Golden Century, Clan Coyote technicians reworked this venerable design. They studied battle data from as far back as the Amaris Civil War and used this research as the basis for their upgrades. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03
column3: The UrbanMech IIC is a Clan IIC-style upgrade of the original UrbanMech. Around the same time as the development of the OmniMech during the Golden Century, Clan Coyote technicians reworked this venerable design. They studied battle data from as far back as the Amaris Civil War and used this research as the basis for their upgrades. Склонность: 360° Torso Twist Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.03

column2: The product of an aborted series of experiments into LAM technology, the Urbanmech LAM is not surprisingly; poorly suited for either role. Designed by the self proclaimed professor of Cluffs Stand, Mencius Horvat; using a mixture of stolen Urbanmech parts and Lostech recovered from throughout the Periphery. Slow by LAM standards and drastically under gunned by Urbanmech standards, this mech struggles to fill either role. That said, the shock factor of an Urbanmech LAM deployed against uninformed opponents, has allowed it a measure of success when used as a raider. Dual ER Mediums and a bevy of rockets provide a nasty punch at close quarters, but prove mediocre at longer ranges. The only known examples of this mech were were recovered by the DMI and were turned over to the NAIS, though their current status is unknown. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
column3: The product of an aborted series of experiments into LAM technology, the Urbanmech LAM is not surprisingly; poorly suited for either role. Designed by the self proclaimed professor of Cluffs Stand, Mencius Horvat; using a mixture of stolen Urbanmech parts and Lostech recovered from throughout the Periphery. Slow by LAM standards and drastically under gunned by Urbanmech standards, this mech struggles to fill either role. That said, the shock factor of an Urbanmech LAM deployed against uninformed opponents, has allowed it a measure of success when used as a raider. Dual ER Mediums and a bevy of rockets provide a nasty punch at close quarters, but prove mediocre at longer ranges. The only known examples of this mech were were recovered by the DMI and were turned over to the NAIS, though their current status is unknown. Склонность: Land Air Mech Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

column2: Meant for close in city fighting, the R60LL replaces its Autocannon 20 with a Ultra version. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
column3: Meant for close in city fighting, the R60LL replaces its Autocannon 20 with a Ultra version. Склонность: 360° Torso Twist Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

column2: Meant for close in city fighting the R61L got upgraded with Stealth Equipment alongside its less expensive R60L cousins AC20. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
column3: Meant for close in city fighting the R61L got upgraded with Stealth Equipment alongside its less expensive R60L cousins AC20. Склонность: 360° Torso Twist Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

column2: Designed by Cataclysm, a former Freeborn Clan Wolf MechWarrior turned Mercenary, and infamous UrbanMech fanatic, this refit is designed to be a cost-effective and logistically reliable way to garrison cities. For the price of a single Awesome, one could afford to refit an entire lance of UrbanMechs to the R8Q standard. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99
column3: Designed by Cataclysm, a former Freeborn Clan Wolf MechWarrior turned Mercenary, and infamous UrbanMech fanatic, this refit is designed to be a cost-effective and logistically reliable way to garrison cities. For the price of a single Awesome, one could afford to refit an entire lance of UrbanMechs to the R8Q standard. Склонность: 360° Torso Twist Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

column2: One Man's Trash
column3: One Man's Trash

column2: According to Corbu's map, our Star League \"stapler factory\" should be somewhere just ahead of you. He also said that we shouldn't run up against anything more dangerous than a combat vehicle or two, but I'd take that with a grain of salt.
column3: According to Corbu's map, our Star League "stapler factory" should be somewhere just ahead of you. He also said that we shouldn't run up against anything more dangerous than a combat vehicle or two, but I'd take that with a grain of salt.

column2: Perhaps more than a grain. I don't especially trust Mr. Corbu, or his mysterious associates.
column3: Perhaps more than a grain. I don't especially trust Mr. Corbu, or his mysterious associates.

column2: Me neither, but it's refreshing to work for someone who's obviously sketchy for a change. I mean, most of our clients are just as bad, but they're much better at hiding it.
column3: Me neither, but it's refreshing to work for someone who's obviously sketchy for a change. I mean, most of our clients are just as bad, but they're much better at hiding it.

column2: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.
column3: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.

column2: I see that we've got some new BattleMechs on the field. Hello. My name is Binton, and if you've come for the vault, my hired cutthroats will be murdering you today.
column3: I see that we've got some new BattleMechs on the field. Hello. My name is Binton, and if you've come for the vault, my hired cutthroats will be murdering you today.

column2: Men Lojowen is my island, Binton. If I catch either of you near that vault, you'll only wish you were dead. I've got a bucket of Proserpinan blood limpets and a vivid imagination, and I'm feeling eager to use 'em.
column3: Men Lojowen is my island, Binton. If I catch either of you near that vault, you'll only wish you were dead. I've got a bucket of Proserpinan blood limpets and a vivid imagination, and I'm feeling eager to use 'em.

column2: Then I guess we'd better not let you catch us. Game faces on, everybody. We've got a fight on our hands.
column3: Then I guess we'd better not let you catch us. Game faces on, everybody. We've got a fight on our hands.

column2: Commander, I've been studying the symbols on the crates that our lance pulled from the facility. Against all odds, it looks like Mr. Corbu was telling us the truth. We've just stolen several tons of commercial-grade LosTech desk accessories.
column3: Commander, I've been studying the symbols on the crates that our lance pulled from the facility. Against all odds, it looks like Mr. Corbu was telling us the truth. We've just stolen several tons of commercial-grade LosTech desk accessories.

column2: Well, that's one for the record books. We just pulled the biggest stapler heist in human history.
column3: Well, that's one for the record books. We just pulled the biggest stapler heist in human history.

column2: And to think, Binton and Modge have been at each other's throats over this vault for months. People have died for this. How do we break it to them they were fighting over garbage?
column3: And to think, Binton and Modge have been at each other's throats over this vault for months. People have died for this. How do we break it to them they were fighting over garbage?

column2: It isn't our job to break anything to them. All we need to do is get this crap to Louth Abbey and get paid. Speaking of which, I'm setting a course, Commander. We'll get Corbu on the horn as soon as we reach cruising altitude.
column3: It isn't our job to break anything to them. All we need to do is get this crap to Louth Abbey and get paid. Speaking of which, I'm setting a course, Commander. We'll get Corbu on the horn as soon as we reach cruising altitude.

column2: That was the heaviest \"light resistance\" I've ever seen. Corbu's gonna have to find someone else to appease his associates, whoever the hell they are. We're out of here.
column3: That was the heaviest "light resistance" I've ever seen. Corbu's gonna have to find someone else to appease his associates, whoever the hell they are. We're out of here.

column2: We've taken possession of the stapler factory, Commander. Keep our scavenger friends occupied and away from the facility while our people crack the vault.
column3: We've taken possession of the stapler factory, Commander. Keep our scavenger friends occupied and away from the facility while our people crack the vault.

column2: [GENERIC VO] The asset is sustaining damage, Commander!
column3: [GENERIC VO] The asset is sustaining damage, Commander!

column2: [GENERIC VO] The secondary asset is sustaining damage, Commander!
column3: [GENERIC VO] The secondary asset is sustaining damage, Commander!

column2: [GENERIC VO] The asset has been recovered, Commander. Good work.
column3: [GENERIC VO] The asset has been recovered, Commander. Good work.

column2: [GENERIC VO] The secondary asset has been recovered, Commander.
column3: [GENERIC VO] The secondary asset has been recovered, Commander.

column2: Well, there goes half our cargo. Better keep our other cargo carrier safe, Boss. We don't wanna bail out of this mess empty-handed.
column3: Well, there goes half our cargo. Better keep our other cargo carrier safe, Boss. We don't wanna bail out of this mess empty-handed.

column2: Well. This should be exciting.
column3: Well. This should be exciting.

column3: The objective for the player to retrieve the primary rescue target.

column3: Loot the Star League Stapler Factory

column3: UNUSED KILL OBJECTIVE for AutoComplete

column3: Hidden KILL OBJECTIVE for OpFor1

column3: The objective to escape with all player units.

column3: Proceed to the Evac Zone

column3: Ensure Secondary Asset Recovery unit survives

column2: I've given your pilot a map of Men Lojowen, complete with the rough location of the Star League installation. I want you to get in there, brush aside any resistance, and loot whatever your BattleMechs can carry. You'll get your pay when my associates have the goods.
column3: I've given your pilot a map of Men Lojowen, complete with the rough location of the Star League installation. I want you to get in there, brush aside any resistance, and loot whatever your BattleMechs can carry. You'll get your pay when my associates have the goods.

column2: One Man's Trash II
column3: One Man's Trash II

column2: Eyes up, Modge. Corbu's pet mercenaries are here.
column3: Eyes up, Modge. Corbu's pet mercenaries are here.

column2: Took 'em long enough. But now they're gonna give us what's ours, aren't they? 'Cause they know their buddy Ed will pay for it if they don't. So they'll relinquish our treasure, nice and easy, and then fly off into the sunset together.
column3: Took 'em long enough. But now they're gonna give us what's ours, aren't they? 'Cause they know their buddy Ed will pay for it if they don't. So they'll relinquish our treasure, nice and easy, and then fly off into the sunset together.

column2: There isn't any treasure, pal. It's just a bunch of staplers and desk lamps. That's what your people were fighting over, by the way.
column3: There isn't any treasure, pal. It's just a bunch of staplers and desk lamps. That's what your people were fighting over, by the way.

column2: I can see why you're working with Corbu. You're as full of shit as he is. Two peas in a pod, you are.
column3: I can see why you're working with Corbu. You're as full of shit as he is. Two peas in a pod, you are.

column2: Never could stand peas, the little green bastards. Why, I feel ill just thinking about 'em. Violently ill, if you catch my meaning.
column3: Never could stand peas, the little green bastards. Why, I feel ill just thinking about 'em. Violently ill, if you catch my meaning.

column2: Gods. Leave it to Corbu to find the two mercs on Glentworth who'd try to intimidate us with a vegetable metaphor. Please, Commander—for the sake of a grateful universe—let's put these jackasses in the ground.
column3: Gods. Leave it to Corbu to find the two mercs on Glentworth who'd try to intimidate us with a vegetable metaphor. Please, Commander—for the sake of a grateful universe—let's put these jackasses in the ground.

column2: That's done it, Commander! By all the gods, you have done it. Binton and Modge are dead—
column3: That's done it, Commander! By all the gods, you have done it. Binton and Modge are dead—

column2: Our foot soldiers are dead, you idiot. We are alive and well, and we will come for you!
column3: Our foot soldiers are dead, you idiot. We are alive and well, and we will come for you!

column2: Best of luck with that, pal—I'll be long gone before you get here. I'm done with this condo, I'm done with Louth Abbey, I'm done with this entire gods-damned system.
column3: Best of luck with that, pal—I'll be long gone before you get here. I'm done with this condo, I'm done with Louth Abbey, I'm done with this entire gods-damned system.

column2: I swear, Corbu, if you split with my treasure…
column3: I swear, Corbu, if you split with my treasure…

column2: There is no treasure! It's staplers! Just staplers!
column3: There is no treasure! It's staplers! Just staplers!

column2: If I split, you'll do what exactly, Modge? Cry? Go ahead, see where it gets you. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna accept {COMMANDER.Callsign}'s delivery, fence it to my associates, and fly off into the sunset. I'm finished here. Corbu out.
column3: If I split, you'll do what exactly, Modge? Cry? Go ahead, see where it gets you. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna accept {COMMANDER.Callsign}'s delivery, fence it to my associates, and fly off into the sunset. I'm finished here. Corbu out.

column2: Aww, man. What an absolute mess. And to think, all of this could've been avoided if you'd given us our treasure.
column3: Aww, man. What an absolute mess. And to think, all of this could've been avoided if you'd given us our treasure.

column2: THERE IS NO TREASURE!
column3: THERE IS NO TREASURE!

column2: And now, there's no Corbu, either. Tough break for you, and an even tougher break for him.
column3: And now, there's no Corbu, either. Tough break for you, and an even tougher break for him.

column2: We're in position! All engineers have disembarked from the personnel carriers. The APCs will scatter and support you. Keep the turrets online and we'll keep firing.
column3: We're in position! All engineers have disembarked from the personnel carriers. The APCs will scatter and support you. Keep the turrets online and we'll keep firing.

column2: Warning commander, sensors are reading multiple contacts approaching from multiple vectors. Looks like the attacking force has brought reinforcements.
column3: Warning commander, sensors are reading multiple contacts approaching from multiple vectors. Looks like the attacking force has brought reinforcements.

column2: Be advised, some of the target buildings are sustaining damage. Your mission is to keep them standing.
column3: Be advised, some of the target buildings are sustaining damage. Your mission is to keep them standing.

column2: Commander, a target building has been demolished. Ensure the integrity of the remaining buildings.
column3: Commander, a target building has been demolished. Ensure the integrity of the remaining buildings.

column2: Uh, hey, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}? My building is the last one standing here. I'd really, really like it if you could keep it standing! Please?
column3: Uh, hey, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}? My building is the last one standing here. I'd really, really like it if you could keep it standing! Please?

column2: Mercenary Commander, we've received word of the assault on your position. Reinforcements are incoming, they are about halfway there. Maintain position and you will be relieved and reinforced shortly.
column3: Mercenary Commander, we've received word of the assault on your position. Reinforcements are incoming, they are about halfway there. Maintain position and you will be relieved and reinforced shortly.

column2: Commander, on this outing we have some additional support from our employer.
column3: Commander, on this outing we have some additional support from our employer.

column2: They have point defenses set up around the base. However, they are offline.
column3: They have point defenses set up around the base. However, they are offline.

column3: We have a friendly convoy of engineers eager to get at those defenses and bring them online.

column2: Escort them safely to the generators. We can boost our defensive capabilities with those turrets activated. Good luck!
column3: Escort them safely to the generators. We can boost our defensive capabilities with those turrets activated. Good luck!

column2: Corbu's time-share is in a civilian housing development, not a military base. We're gonna have to hustle if we want to protect it.
column3: Corbu's time-share is in a civilian housing development, not a military base. We're gonna have to hustle if we want to protect it.

column3: Defend Ed Corbu's Condo Complex

column2: Baddies Inbound
column3: Baddies Inbound

column2: The last time I checked, Binton and Modge had a bunch of combat vehicles in the streets around my time-share. Maybe a light 'Mech or two, I can't say for sure. Get 'em off my back, and then we'll conclude our business with the antique staplers.
column3: The last time I checked, Binton and Modge had a bunch of combat vehicles in the streets around my time-share. Maybe a light 'Mech or two, I can't say for sure. Get 'em off my back, and then we'll conclude our business with the antique staplers.

column2: One Man's Trash II
column3: One Man's Trash II

column2: Eyes up, Modge. Corbu's pet mercenaries are here.
column3: Eyes up, Modge. Corbu's pet mercenaries are here.

column2: Took 'em long enough. But now they're gonna give us what's ours, aren't they? Their buddy Ed already told us as much. So they'll relinquish our treasure, nice and easy, and then fly off into the sunset together.
column3: Took 'em long enough. But now they're gonna give us what's ours, aren't they? Their buddy Ed already told us as much. So they'll relinquish our treasure, nice and easy, and then fly off into the sunset together.

column2: It's already done, Modge. If you run a sensor sweep, you'll find a handful of very large crates about 300 meters from where you're standing.
column3: It's already done, Modge. If you run a sensor sweep, you'll find a handful of very large crates about 300 meters from where you're standing.

column2: Huh. Whaddya know? There they are.
column3: Huh. Whaddya know? There they are.

column2: And I'll be taking them. I'd advise you all to stand down, but I know that you won't listen, so I think I'll just shoot you instead.
column3: And I'll be taking them. I'd advise you all to stand down, but I know that you won't listen, so I think I'll just shoot you instead.

column2: Not if I beat you to it, you insufferable prick! I've been waiting for an opportunity to put you down!
column3: Not if I beat you to it, you insufferable prick! I've been waiting for an opportunity to put you down!

column2: That's done it, Commander! By all the gods, you have done it. Binton and Modge are dead, we've still got our staplers, and we're all gonna walk away from this with a nice, fat paycheck in our pockets.
column3: That's done it, Commander! By all the gods, you have done it. Binton and Modge are dead, we've still got our staplers, and we're all gonna walk away from this with a nice, fat paycheck in our pockets.

column2: I'll believe that when I see it.
column3: I'll believe that when I see it.

column2: You won't have to wait long. If you'd be so kind as to scoop up the \"treasure,\" I'll fence it to my associates, and then we can all fly off into the sunset. Our job here is done.
column3: You won't have to wait long. If you'd be so kind as to scoop up the "treasure," I'll fence it to my associates, and then we can all fly off into the sunset. Our job here is done.

column2: Primary targets destroyed Commander.
column3: Primary targets destroyed Commander.

column2: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.
column3: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.

column2: I've got bad news for the lot of you. You're standing between me and my treasure, and that's a bad place for you to be. Now, smashing your 'Mechs won't be quite as satisfying as dunking your heads in a bucket of blood limpets, but given the circumstances, I'm willing to settle.
column3: I've got bad news for the lot of you. You're standing between me and my treasure, and that's a bad place for you to be. Now, smashing your 'Mechs won't be quite as satisfying as dunking your heads in a bucket of blood limpets, but given the circumstances, I'm willing to settle.

column2: Remind me to smack Ed for ever having hired this guy.
column3: Remind me to smack Ed for ever having hired this guy.

column2: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} lance has arrived!

column2: I've told Binton and Modge that you're gonna drop their \"treasure\" in a field about a hundred klicks southeast of Louth Abbey. That should put you far enough away to avoid collateral damage, so feel free to go after 'em with whatever BattleMechs you like. Just be aware that there's nothing stopping them from doin' the same to you.
column3: I've told Binton and Modge that you're gonna drop their "treasure" in a field about a hundred klicks southeast of Louth Abbey. That should put you far enough away to avoid collateral damage, so feel free to go after 'em with whatever BattleMechs you like. Just be aware that there's nothing stopping them from doin' the same to you.

column2: Red Hunt I
column3: Red Hunt I

column2: To be completely honest with you, I haven't the faintest idea what kind of research goes on here. Nevertheless, a credible threat has been made. Your opposition is a mercenary company using the rather grandiose name \"[[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGrayDeath],Gray Death Legion]].\"
column3: To be completely honest with you, I haven't the faintest idea what kind of research goes on here. Nevertheless, a credible threat has been made. Your opposition is a mercenary company using the rather grandiose name "[[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGrayDeath],Gray Death Legion]]."

column2: Huh. I've heard of them. Made a name for themselves on the Lyran and Draconis border. Their commander is supposed to be a hot-shit tactician.
column3: Huh. I've heard of them. Made a name for themselves on the Lyran and Draconis border. Their commander is supposed to be a hot-shit tactician.

column2: Imagine me rolling my eyes dramatically. At any rate, my people tell me there are at least two lances of enemy 'Mechs on the surface, advancing toward your position. I have inbound aerospace support, so all you need to do is hold out until it arrives.
column3: Imagine me rolling my eyes dramatically. At any rate, my people tell me there are at least two lances of enemy 'Mechs on the surface, advancing toward your position. I have inbound aerospace support, so all you need to do is hold out until it arrives.

column2: Keep the facility intact, and hold out for the cavalry. Shouldn't be a problem, Shugo Yamaguchi.
column3: Keep the facility intact, and hold out for the cavalry. Shouldn't be a problem, Shugo Yamaguchi.

column2: Commander, this is Grayson Carlyle. That was a hell of an ass kicking. Glad we were in salvaged 'Mechs. Listen, I don't have a bone to pick with you; I just need what's in that facility. I've got reinforcements landing shortly and— [static]
column3: Commander, this is Grayson Carlyle. That was a hell of an ass kicking. Glad we were in salvaged 'Mechs. Listen, I don't have a bone to pick with you; I just need what's in that facility. I've got reinforcements landing shortly and— [static]

column2: Mercenary Commander: this is the Draconis [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreISF],Internal Security Force]]. We are interdicting this world in pursuit of the wanted criminal Grayson Carlyle. Do not attempt to enter orbit, or you will be fired on.
column3: Mercenary Commander: this is the Draconis [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreISF],Internal Security Force]]. We are interdicting this world in pursuit of the wanted criminal Grayson Carlyle. Do not attempt to enter orbit, or you will be fired on.

column2: What the— Boss, I've got multiple lock-ons coming from the surface. They've got me in their crosshairs. What the hell is this?
column3: What the— Boss, I've got multiple lock-ons coming from the surface. They've got me in their crosshairs. What the hell is this?

column2: Commander, will someone please tell me what's going on down there? I can't contact my people, and the JumpShip captain isn't answering— [static]
column3: Commander, will someone please tell me what's going on down there? I can't contact my people, and the JumpShip captain isn't answering— [static]

column2: Darius? We just lost the comms relay signal from the system's JumpShip. Either it was destroyed, or it just jumped out.
column3: Darius? We just lost the comms relay signal from the system's JumpShip. Either it was destroyed, or it just jumped out.

column2: Additionally, our communications are being disrupted by a ground installation. We can relay messages through the Leopard, but only over short distances.
column3: Additionally, our communications are being disrupted by a ground installation. We can relay messages through the Leopard, but only over short distances.

column2: What the hell is— Combine forces, we're on your side. Stand down, we're the good guys!
column3: What the hell is— Combine forces, we're on your side. Stand down, we're the good guys!

column2: Shit! Boss, they just fired a PPC off the Leopard's bow. I'm going nap-of-the-earth to try to shake them.
column3: Shit! Boss, they just fired a PPC off the Leopard's bow. I'm going nap-of-the-earth to try to shake them.

column2: I don't want to say \"I told you so,\" but… I think we just got double-crossed. They're after Carlyle, but I bet we're acceptable collateral damage.
column3: I don't want to say "I told you so," but… I think we just got double-crossed. They're after Carlyle, but I bet we're acceptable collateral damage.

column2: Commander, we need to pull Carlyle's ass out of the fire if we're going to figure out what the hell is going on. Let's get to him before the Combine does.
column3: Commander, we need to pull Carlyle's ass out of the fire if we're going to figure out what the hell is going on. Let's get to him before the Combine does.

column2: We're in position! All engineers have disembarked from the personnel carriers. The APCs will scatter and support you. Keep the turrets online and we'll keep firing.
column3: We're in position! All engineers have disembarked from the personnel carriers. The APCs will scatter and support you. Keep the turrets online and we'll keep firing.

column2: Warning commander, sensors are reading multiple contacts approaching from multiple vectors. Looks like the attacking force has brought reinforcements.
column3: Warning commander, sensors are reading multiple contacts approaching from multiple vectors. Looks like the attacking force has brought reinforcements.

column2: Be advised, some of the target buildings are sustaining damage. Your mission is to keep them standing.
column3: Be advised, some of the target buildings are sustaining damage. Your mission is to keep them standing.

column2: Commander, a target building has been demolished. Ensure the integrity of the remaining buildings.
column3: Commander, a target building has been demolished. Ensure the integrity of the remaining buildings.

column2: Only one building left standing, Commander. If we don't protect it, the mission fails.
column3: Only one building left standing, Commander. If we don't protect it, the mission fails.

column2: Mercenary Commander, we've received word of the assault on your position. Reinforcements are incoming, they are about halfway there. Maintain position and you will be relieved and reinforced shortly.
column3: Mercenary Commander, we've received word of the assault on your position. Reinforcements are incoming, they are about halfway there. Maintain position and you will be relieved and reinforced shortly.

column2: Commander, on this outing we have some additional support from our employer.
column3: Commander, on this outing we have some additional support from our employer.

column2: They have point defenses set up around the base. However, they are offline.
column3: They have point defenses set up around the base. However, they are offline.

column2: We have a friendly convoy with engineers who are eager to get at those defenses, so they can bring them online.
column3: We have a friendly convoy with engineers who are eager to get at those defenses, so they can bring them online.

column2: Escort them safely to the generators, and we can boost our defensive capability with those turrets activated. Good luck!
column3: Escort them safely to the generators, and we can boost our defensive capability with those turrets activated. Good luck!

column2: This seems simple enough, which makes me nervous. I don't like when we're asked to defend \"research\" without knowing what the research is.
column3: This seems simple enough, which makes me nervous. I don't like when we're asked to defend "research" without knowing what the research is.

column3: Defend Targeted Base Structures from Attackers

column3: Defend Target Buildings

column2: Baddies Inbound
column3: Baddies Inbound

column2: Commander, this installation is a vital part of Combine research efforts, and we need to ensure the enemy doesn't destroy it. We believe the opposing forces are a mercenary unit hired by our erstwhile allies in the Free Worlds League, and their intent is to disrupt the important work being done here. Your job will be to hold them off until they exhaust themselves, at which point we'll launch our own counterattack.
column3: Commander, this installation is a vital part of Combine research efforts, and we need to ensure the enemy doesn't destroy it. We believe the opposing forces are a mercenary unit hired by our erstwhile allies in the Free Worlds League, and their intent is to disrupt the important work being done here. Your job will be to hold them off until they exhaust themselves, at which point we'll launch our own counterattack.

column2: Red Hunt II
column3: Red Hunt II

column2: Carlyle. This is Darius Oliveira, XO of the Argo. We need some answers about what just happened.
column3: Carlyle. This is Darius Oliveira, XO of the Argo. We need some answers about what just happened.

column2: Little busy right now, Argo. Trying not to get shot. You want to have a chat? Then help us get clear of this trap.
column3: Little busy right now, Argo. Trying not to get shot. You want to have a chat? Then help us get clear of this trap.

column2: Heads up, Commander! I'm seeing unmarked 'Mechs and Leopards inbound to your position.
column3: Heads up, Commander! I'm seeing unmarked 'Mechs and Leopards inbound to your position.

column2: That's going to be the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDEST],DEST]] units. They'll shoot first and… they won't ask any questions at all, actually.
column3: That's going to be the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDEST],DEST]] units. They'll shoot first and… they won't ask any questions at all, actually.

column2: We can make short hops in the Leopard, but the second we head out into orbit, we'll light their sensors up and they'll turn us to scrap.
column3: We can make short hops in the Leopard, but the second we head out into orbit, we'll light their sensors up and they'll turn us to scrap.

column2: But if we can take out some of their ground-based firepower, we should be able to make a run for it through whatever's left. You'll, ah, need to catch your own ride, though.
column3: But if we can take out some of their ground-based firepower, we should be able to make a run for it through whatever's left. You'll, ah, need to catch your own ride, though.

column2: I'm on that. Commander, destroy some of their 'Mechs to reduce the enemy flak a little. Then, I'll pick you up, and we'll break for orbit right under their noses.
column3: I'm on that. Commander, destroy some of their 'Mechs to reduce the enemy flak a little. Then, I'll pick you up, and we'll break for orbit right under their noses.

column2: We made it, Argo. Let's have a chat.
column3: We made it, Argo. Let's have a chat.

column2: That's enough of them dead that we can start our evac. Just need to get my people to the LZ.
column3: That's enough of them dead that we can start our evac. Just need to get my people to the LZ.

column2: I'm ready to pick our team up, too, Commander. Just get to the LZ, and I'll do a hot pickup.
column3: I'm ready to pick our team up, too, Commander. Just get to the LZ, and I'll do a hot pickup.

column2: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} lance has arrived!
column3: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} lance has arrived!

column2: Our Employer has kindly added this group to the contract. If we want to get paid we need to take them out.
column3: Our Employer has kindly added this group to the contract. If we want to get paid we need to take them out.

column2: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} lance has arrived!

column2: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.
column3: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.

column2: We've taken care of enough of them to let our Leopard make it to orbit. We're starting our withdrawal, Commander. See you upstairs.
column3: We've taken care of enough of them to let our Leopard make it to orbit. We're starting our withdrawal, Commander. See you upstairs.

column2: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.
column3: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: The Gray Death Legion is clear, Commander. We can get the hell out of here whenever you're ready.

column2: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.
column3: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.
column3: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column2: Shit. Commander, we need to cut and run; we aren't salvaging this situation.
column3: Shit. Commander, we need to cut and run; we aren't salvaging this situation.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column2: That's another DEST lance on the field. Christ, Carlyle, what did you do to these people to piss them off this much?
column3: That's another DEST lance on the field. Christ, Carlyle, what did you do to these people to piss them off this much?

column2: I didn't die when Duke Ricol asked me to. I guess that's considered rude in the Combine.
column3: I didn't die when Duke Ricol asked me to. I guess that's considered rude in the Combine.

column2: More {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} forces on the field!

column2: Duke Ricol sends his regards, Carlyle.
column3: Duke Ricol sends his regards, Carlyle.

column2: Ricol? Hell, that guy's like a bad smell you just can't wash out of your cockpit.

column2: Shit! Argo, I'm losing people down here. We need more covering fire!
