column2: It looks like we're both on the Kurita shit list, Commander. This situation is bad and getting worse. My people are pinned down by fire from the DEST forces, and we can't use our Leopard to get into orbit. We've evacuated the Fire Lance, but the Command Lance is still stuck on-world—which concerns me personally, because I'm part of the Command Lance and one of the people who's stuck. I want to get to the bottom of this mess, but I'm going to need your help.
column3: It looks like we're both on the Kurita shit list, Commander. This situation is bad and getting worse. My people are pinned down by fire from the DEST forces, and we can't use our Leopard to get into orbit. We've evacuated the Fire Lance, but the Command Lance is still stuck on-world—which concerns me personally, because I'm part of the Command Lance and one of the people who's stuck. I want to get to the bottom of this mess, but I'm going to need your help.

column2: Red Hunt III
column3: Red Hunt III

column2: The Kurita base is just ahead, Commander. All we have to do is get in there, level the place, and get out again.
column3: The Kurita base is just ahead, Commander. All we have to do is get in there, level the place, and get out again.

column2: Boss, I've got blips that look like gun emplacements powering up. So, expect turrets.
column3: Boss, I've got blips that look like gun emplacements powering up. So, expect turrets.

column2: We should encounter significant resistance; as soon as the DEST teams realize their command center is under attack, they'll fall back to stop us.
column3: We should encounter significant resistance; as soon as the DEST teams realize their command center is under attack, they'll fall back to stop us.

column2: Carlyle, you are clear to begin your assault.
column3: Carlyle, you are clear to begin your assault.

column2: Roger that. Here comes some ass kicking, courtesy of the Gray Death Legion.
column3: Roger that. Here comes some ass kicking, courtesy of the Gray Death Legion.

column2: Once we've got the signal transmitting, we'll meet up aboard the Invidious. See you in a bit, Commander. Carlyle out.
column3: Once we've got the signal transmitting, we'll meet up aboard the Invidious. See you in a bit, Commander. Carlyle out.

column2: Is it just me, or does he seem a little too enthusiastic about killing Kuritans?
column3: Is it just me, or does he seem a little too enthusiastic about killing Kuritans?

column2: I don't know if that's even possible.
column3: I don't know if that's even possible.

column2: Stow it, both of you. Let's get back aboard the Argo.
column3: Stow it, both of you. Let's get back aboard the Argo.

column2: Commander, we have DEST units closing on our position. Is the base down? Are we ready to engage? Commander— [static]
column3: Commander, we have DEST units closing on our position. Is the base down? Are we ready to engage? Commander— [static]

column2: Boss, I'm seeing more 'Mech engine signatures out there. Be prepared for enemy reinforcements.
column3: Boss, I'm seeing more 'Mech engine signatures out there. Be prepared for enemy reinforcements.

column2: We've demolished the objective buildings. No need to loiter, get to the evac zone.
column3: We've demolished the objective buildings. No need to loiter, get to the evac zone.

column2: Good shots, Commander! You scored a solid hit on one of the target structures, keep it up.
column3: Good shots, Commander! You scored a solid hit on one of the target structures, keep it up.

column2: Target building destroyed, good work commander, stay at it and we'll be done in no time.
column3: Target building destroyed, good work commander, stay at it and we'll be done in no time.

column2: Bkt_KillConfirmed: The garrison is destroyed. Good Work.
column3: Bkt_KillConfirmed: The garrison is destroyed. Good Work.

column2: As long as Carlyle's people can handle their part of this operation, we shouldn't have any trouble destroying the base.
column3: As long as Carlyle's people can handle their part of this operation, we shouldn't have any trouble destroying the base.

column2: The objective to destroy the targeted buildings.
column3: The objective to destroy the targeted buildings.

column3: Destroy Kurita Military Base

column2: The primary objective to destroy the garrison / defenders of the base.
column3: The primary objective to destroy the garrison / defenders of the base.

column3: Destroy Base Defenders

column3: HIDDEN Objective: Destroy Base Turrets

column3: HIDDEN Objective: Destroy Base Turrets

column2: Commander, we're prepared to start our assault on the ComStar facility. Before we make our move, we need you to take out that military base, so that DEST can't coordinate a response. Once that base is rubble, give us the all clear. Then we'll commence our attack, break in there, and broadcast the signal to Tor.
column3: Commander, we're prepared to start our assault on the ComStar facility. Before we make our move, we need you to take out that military base, so that DEST can't coordinate a response. Once that base is rubble, give us the all clear. Then we'll commence our attack, break in there, and broadcast the signal to Tor.

column2: Red Hunt III
column3: Red Hunt III

column2: The Kurita military outpost is rubble, Commander. You're clear to begin your assault. Good luck.
column3: The Kurita military outpost is rubble, Commander. You're clear to begin your assault. Good luck.

column2: Affirmative, Carlyle. Commander, I've identified a good vantage point where you can get eyes on the facility. That should tell us what we're dealing with.
column3: Affirmative, Carlyle. Commander, I've identified a good vantage point where you can get eyes on the facility. That should tell us what we're dealing with.

column2: Let's get moving; I don't like being stuck in one place this long.
column3: Let's get moving; I don't like being stuck in one place this long.

column2: Commander, I've got a line open to the facility, and it's under our control now. Broadcasting Carlyle's message.
column3: Commander, I've got a line open to the facility, and it's under our control now. Broadcasting Carlyle's message.

column2: … [static] …
column3: … [static] …

column2: … [static] …ello? Hello, do you copy? This is the Invidious. We copy and are standing on station. See you in a few.
column3: … [static] …ello? Hello, do you copy? This is the Invidious. We copy and are standing on station. See you in a few.

column2: This is the Argo. We copy, Invidious. Carlyle, are you receiving this?
column3: This is the Argo. We copy, Invidious. Carlyle, are you receiving this?

column2: Affirmative. Let's get out of here. Drinks are on me.
column3: Affirmative. Let's get out of here. Drinks are on me.

column2: Shit. We dropped the ball on this one, Commander.
column3: Shit. We dropped the ball on this one, Commander.

column2: Bogeys on sensors!
column3: Bogeys on sensors!

column2: [GENERIC VO] Area is not clear, Commander. Eliminate the hostiles before continuing to the next Objective.
column3: [GENERIC VO] Area is not clear, Commander. Eliminate the hostiles before continuing to the next Objective.

column2: [GENERIC VO] Sensors are clear, proceed to the next objective.
column3: [GENERIC VO] Sensors are clear, proceed to the next objective.

column2: DropShip inbound for landing! We're going to get in and out quick!
column3: DropShip inbound for landing! We're going to get in and out quick!

column2: XO, I'm seeing turrets coming online at the base. Did we know there were automated defenses?
column3: XO, I'm seeing turrets coming online at the base. Did we know there were automated defenses?

column2: No, but I'm not surprised. Commander, those are big turrets. Be careful.
column3: No, but I'm not surprised. Commander, those are big turrets. Be careful.

column2: You should be able to see the ComStar facility from here, Commander. Looks like DEST got the base turrets running, as we suspected.
column3: You should be able to see the ComStar facility from here, Commander. Looks like DEST got the base turrets running, as we suspected.

column2: Occupy the facility and take care of any additional DEST forces that show up. Good luck, Commander.
column3: Occupy the facility and take care of any additional DEST forces that show up. Good luck, Commander.

column2: As long as Carlyle's people can handle their part of this operation, we shouldn't have any trouble taking the base.
column3: As long as Carlyle's people can handle their part of this operation, we shouldn't have any trouble taking the base.

column2: The objective to scout the base that is being captured. Must be completed before the actual capture of the base.
column3: The objective to scout the base that is being captured. Must be completed before the actual capture of the base.

column2: Scout the ComStar Facility
column3: Scout the ComStar Facility

column2: The objective to optionally destroy the defenders of the base.
column3: The objective to optionally destroy the defenders of the base.

column2: Destroy DEST defensive force
column3: Destroy DEST defensive force

column2: The objective for the player to move into and capture the base.
column3: The objective for the player to move into and capture the base.

column2: Move friendly 'Mechs into base
column3: Move friendly 'Mechs into base

column3: HIDDEN TIMER, NO NEED TO EDIT: This is the hidden timer objective that will trigger the enemy reinforcements.

column2: Hold Out as Enemies Counterattack
column3: Hold Out as Enemies Counterattack

column2: This is a general objective to indicate the player must keep playing and eliminate enemies as they come.
column3: This is a general objective to indicate the player must keep playing and eliminate enemies as they come.

column2: Destroy any additional DEST forces
column3: Destroy any additional DEST forces

column2: The primary objective to destroy the force that tries to remove the player from the captured base.
column3: The primary objective to destroy the force that tries to remove the player from the captured base.

column2: Destroy the DEST Reinforcements
column3: Destroy the DEST Reinforcements

column2: The chunk controlled objective to destroy the turrets for the base, if the chunk is active.
column3: The chunk controlled objective to destroy the turrets for the base, if the chunk is active.

column2: Eliminate Base Turrets
column3: Eliminate Base Turrets

column2: Commander, we're starting our assault. As soon as we take out the Combine military base, the Kuritans will lose their ability to coordinate a response. That's your cue to move in and capture the ComStar facility, shut down the jamming gear DEST set up there, and get our signal broadcasting. We've got a pretty big window before Tor leaves again, so the only hurry is that our DEST friends aren't going to sit on their hands after we start shooting at them.
column3: Commander, we're starting our assault. As soon as we take out the Combine military base, the Kuritans will lose their ability to coordinate a response. That's your cue to move in and capture the ComStar facility, shut down the jamming gear DEST set up there, and get our signal broadcasting. We've got a pretty big window before Tor leaves again, so the only hurry is that our DEST friends aren't going to sit on their hands after we start shooting at them.

column2: Hearts and Minds
column3: Hearts and Minds

column2: I've been picking up sporadic hits on the Leopard's sensors, Commander. Lady Cunningham was right; Crenshaw is definitely moving through this AO.
column3: I've been picking up sporadic hits on the Leopard's sensors, Commander. Lady Cunningham was right; Crenshaw is definitely moving through this AO.

column2: He's got bodyguards, but there's too much interference for me to get a read on what they're piloting. I'd recommend exercising caution when you make your approach.
column3: He's got bodyguards, but there's too much interference for me to get a read on what they're piloting. I'd recommend exercising caution when you make your approach.

column2: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.
column3: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.

column2: I don't know who you assholes are, but if you're here on Cunningham's dime, I'd recommend giving my lance a wide berth. If you step within our sensor range, I won't hesitate to mow you down.
column3: I don't know who you assholes are, but if you're here on Cunningham's dime, I'd recommend giving my lance a wide berth. If you step within our sensor range, I won't hesitate to mow you down.

column2: Cocky son of a bitch, isn't he? Let's see where that gets him. Go to it, Boss! I'll be cheering you on from here.
column3: Cocky son of a bitch, isn't he? Let's see where that gets him. Go to it, Boss! I'll be cheering you on from here.

column2: Nicely done, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}—I knew that I could count on you. My personal DropShip is currently en route to New Rennes, where Tiesa Norkus— [static]
column3: Nicely done, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}—I knew that I could count on you. My personal DropShip is currently en route to New Rennes, where Tiesa Norkus— [static]

column2: CONNECTION LOST.
column3: CONNECTION LOST.

column2: So much for keeping in touch with our client.
column3: So much for keeping in touch with our client.

column2: Does the timing of that feel a little suspicious to anyone else, or is it just me?
column3: Does the timing of that feel a little suspicious to anyone else, or is it just me?

column2: Oh, it's suspicious, all right. Commander, we just received a tight-beam message from the Emerald Dawn, courtesy of Tiesa Norkus. You're gonna want to see this when you get back.
column3: Oh, it's suspicious, all right. Commander, we just received a tight-beam message from the Emerald Dawn, courtesy of Tiesa Norkus. You're gonna want to see this when you get back.

column2: We've lost this one, Commander. I'm pulling our people out. Lady Cunningham will have to find someone else to deal with the Emerald Dawn.
column3: We've lost this one, Commander. I'm pulling our people out. Lady Cunningham will have to find someone else to deal with the Emerald Dawn.

column2: That's one terrorist down, Commander.
column3: That's one terrorist down, Commander.

column2: Readings indicate the ambushing units are out of commission. The employer will be pleased.
column3: Readings indicate the ambushing units are out of commission. The employer will be pleased.

column2: That is our target, sustain fire on that unit!
column3: That is our target, sustain fire on that unit!

column2: Sensors are showing enemy movement beyond our initial count. Be advised you might meet with increased resistance.
column3: Sensors are showing enemy movement beyond our initial count. Be advised you might meet with increased resistance.

column2: Commander, the target is bugging out! Eliminate them before they escape.
column3: Commander, the target is bugging out! Eliminate them before they escape.

column2: Scratch one Emerald Dawn combat lance.
column3: Scratch one Emerald Dawn combat lance.

column2: This all sounds pretty straightforward, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. Keep your eyes open, all the same.
column3: This all sounds pretty straightforward, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. Keep your eyes open, all the same.

column3: The secondary objective to destroy an additional lance supporting the assassination target.

column3: Destroy Emerald Dawn Outriders

column2: Destroy enemy Ambushers before extraction
column3: Destroy enemy Ambushers before extraction

column2: Destroy Emerald Dawn Vanguard
column3: Destroy Emerald Dawn Vanguard

column3: The objective to destroy the Assassination Target.

column2: Eliminate Matis \"Bishop\" Crenshaw
column3: Eliminate Matis "Bishop" Crenshaw

column2: Hidden Objective for AutoComplete, Destroy Assassination Lance
column3: Hidden Objective for AutoComplete, Destroy Assassination Lance

column2: Destroy Assassination Lance Hidden Objective
column3: Destroy Assassination Lance Hidden Objective

column3: The objective for the player to escape and complete the mission.

column3: Proceed to the evac zone

column3: Prevent the Target from Escaping

column2: Armor of the Target is breached.
column3: Armor of the Target is breached.

column2: Armor Breached
column3: Armor Breached

column2: Matis \"Bishop\" Crenshaw and his retinue are en route to a meeting with Sian Triumphant, a satellite organization of the Emerald Dawn. Intercept Crenshaw's BattleMech, destroy it, and contact my DropShip to confirm the kill.
column3: Matis "Bishop" Crenshaw and his retinue are en route to a meeting with Sian Triumphant, a satellite organization of the Emerald Dawn. Intercept Crenshaw's BattleMech, destroy it, and contact my DropShip to confirm the kill.

column2: Hearts and Minds II
column3: Hearts and Minds II

column2: Your Davion masters aren't going to like this, scum. There are two dozen flag-waving Federation citizens in here who're gonna wind up in pieces if you don't stand down now.
column3: Your Davion masters aren't going to like this, scum. There are two dozen flag-waving Federation citizens in here who're gonna wind up in pieces if you don't stand down now.

column2: That's a damn shame, but if you wanna hide behind human shields, we're in no position to stop you. What we can do is keep you from making any more victims.
column3: That's a damn shame, but if you wanna hide behind human shields, we're in no position to stop you. What we can do is keep you from making any more victims.

column2: Nothing will change if you kill me. You may have us outgunned, but we're fighting for our home. Whatever happens today, the Emerald Dawn will live on.
column3: Nothing will change if you kill me. You may have us outgunned, but we're fighting for our home. Whatever happens today, the Emerald Dawn will live on.

column2: You don't get it, do you? We don't care whether your political movement survives or not. You're just a paycheck to us.
column3: You don't get it, do you? We don't care whether your political movement survives or not. You're just a paycheck to us.

column2: Mercenary pig. You believe in nothing, and I will reduce you to nothing. I will make you pay for my husband's death.
column3: Mercenary pig. You believe in nothing, and I will reduce you to nothing. I will make you pay for my husband's death.

column2: That's done it, Commander. The Emerald Dawn's leadership is dead.
column3: That's done it, Commander. The Emerald Dawn's leadership is dead.

column2: And so are the hostages. Can't say I feel great about that.
column3: And so are the hostages. Can't say I feel great about that.

column2: None of us do. But we all agreed—
column3: None of us do. But we all agreed—

column2: I know what we agreed. That doesn't mean I have to like it.
column3: I know what we agreed. That doesn't mean I have to like it.

column2: I'm getting a new sensor contact, XO. Looks like Lady Cunningham's DropShip. She's here for her photo op, and she probably isn't gonna like what she sees.
column3: I'm getting a new sensor contact, XO. Looks like Lady Cunningham's DropShip. She's here for her photo op, and she probably isn't gonna like what she sees.

column2: I'm scrubbing the mission, Commander. Lady Cunningham will have to find someone else to deal with Tiesa Norkus and her Emerald Dawn.
column3: I'm scrubbing the mission, Commander. Lady Cunningham will have to find someone else to deal with Tiesa Norkus and her Emerald Dawn.

column2: We're pretty deep in Emerald Dawn territory, Commander. Five'll get you ten the area's crawling with hostiles, so keep your eyes peeled.
column3: We're pretty deep in Emerald Dawn territory, Commander. Five'll get you ten the area's crawling with hostiles, so keep your eyes peeled.

column2: We've demolished the objective buildings. No need to loiter, get to the evac zone.
column3: We've demolished the objective buildings. No need to loiter, get to the evac zone.

column2: Good shots, Commander! You scored a solid hit on one of the target structures, keep it up.
column3: Good shots, Commander! You scored a solid hit on one of the target structures, keep it up.

column2: Target building destroyed, good work commander, stay at it and we'll be done in no time.
column3: Target building destroyed, good work commander, stay at it and we'll be done in no time.

column2: Bkt_KillConfirmed: The garrison is destroyed. Good Work.
column3: Bkt_KillConfirmed: The garrison is destroyed. Good Work.

column2: Sometimes you're left with nothing but bad options. This is one of those times, but we're professionals, and it's on us to handle it.
column3: Sometimes you're left with nothing but bad options. This is one of those times, but we're professionals, and it's on us to handle it.

column2: The objective to destroy the targeted buildings.
column3: The objective to destroy the targeted buildings.

column2: Destroy Emerald Dawn Stronghold
column3: Destroy Emerald Dawn Stronghold

column3: The primary objective to destroy the garrison / defenders of the base.

column3: Destroy Emerald Dawn Irregulars

column3: The objective for the player to extract their units.

column2: Get to the evac zone
column3: Get to the evac zone

column2: Tiesa \"Navaja\" Norkus has holed up in the Emerald Dawn's most heavily fortified stronghold, and she's using a number of civilian hostages as human shields. Unfortunately, there isn't much that we can do for those people; Lady Cunningham has made it very clear that eliminating the Emerald Dawn's leadership is imperative, and it'll be impossible for us to take out Norkus without incurring collateral damage.
column3: Tiesa "Navaja" Norkus has holed up in the Emerald Dawn's most heavily fortified stronghold, and she's using a number of civilian hostages as human shields. Unfortunately, there isn't much that we can do for those people; Lady Cunningham has made it very clear that eliminating the Emerald Dawn's leadership is imperative, and it'll be impossible for us to take out Norkus without incurring collateral damage.

column2: Hearts and Minds II
column3: Hearts and Minds II

column2: Keeping your distance, Commander? Good choice. You get any closer and I'll start throwing these traitors out a 30th-floor window. They'll have plenty of time to regret their mistakes before they splatter against the pavement.
column3: Keeping your distance, Commander? Good choice. You get any closer and I'll start throwing these traitors out a 30th-floor window. They'll have plenty of time to regret their mistakes before they splatter against the pavement.

column2: I can't believe this is what passes as a charismatic leader. Seriously, why does anybody follow this woman?
column3: I can't believe this is what passes as a charismatic leader. Seriously, why does anybody follow this woman?

column2: Hatred is a hell of a drug. Commander, we're picking up hostile sensor contacts all over the AO—Emerald Dawn. Looks like a mix of BattleMechs and combat vehicles.
column3: Hatred is a hell of a drug. Commander, we're picking up hostile sensor contacts all over the AO—Emerald Dawn. Looks like a mix of BattleMechs and combat vehicles.

column2: More bad guys means more salvage. With luck, Lady Cunningham will be satisfied enough with the kill count to overlook the fact that we aren't killing Norkus.
column3: More bad guys means more salvage. With luck, Lady Cunningham will be satisfied enough with the kill count to overlook the fact that we aren't killing Norkus.

column2: She'll just have to deal with it, Yang. Let's get to work.
column3: She'll just have to deal with it, Yang. Let's get to work.

column2: That's all of them, Commander. Norkus may still be alive and well in that tower of hers, but her BattleMechs are a different story.
column3: That's all of them, Commander. Norkus may still be alive and well in that tower of hers, but her BattleMechs are a different story.

column2: That's right, mercenary swine. You killed a lot of brave freedom fighters today! Go ahead and pat yourselves on the back, but for every one of my fighters you just cut down, I'll recruit three more.
column3: That's right, mercenary swine. You killed a lot of brave freedom fighters today! Go ahead and pat yourselves on the back, but for every one of my fighters you just cut down, I'll recruit three more.

column2: Well, she's as pleasant as ever. And here comes Lady Cunningham's DropShip, right on cue.
column3: Well, she's as pleasant as ever. And here comes Lady Cunningham's DropShip, right on cue.

column2: Wonderful. I hope you're watching, Commander. I'll give her a welcome she won't soon forget.
column3: Wonderful. I hope you're watching, Commander. I'll give her a welcome she won't soon forget.

column3: Primary targets destroyed Commander.

column3: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.

column2: We may not be able to take out Tiesa Norkus, but at least we can contain her. If she wants to hide behind human shields, fine—let her hide. We'll do as much damage to the Emerald Dawn as we can, and when Lady Cunningham's DropShip touches down, she can handle the hostage negotiations.
column3: We may not be able to take out Tiesa Norkus, but at least we can contain her. If she wants to hide behind human shields, fine—let her hide. We'll do as much damage to the Emerald Dawn as we can, and when Lady Cunningham's DropShip touches down, she can handle the hostage negotiations.

column2: Siegebreaker
column3: Siegebreaker

column2: Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Lieutenant Azura Damestroir here. We appreciate the assistance, because we're gonna need it.
column3: Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Lieutenant Azura Damestroir here. We appreciate the assistance, because we're gonna need it.

column2: We've identified a Lyran Atlas moving through the Museum District. Thankfully enough, the beast appears to have soaked up a lot of punishment over the course of the siege. Why the Lyrans haven't sent it in for repairs yet is beyond me; maybe they're having trouble with their supply chain. I don't know.
column3: We've identified a Lyran Atlas moving through the Museum District. Thankfully enough, the beast appears to have soaked up a lot of punishment over the course of the siege. Why the Lyrans haven't sent it in for repairs yet is beyond me; maybe they're having trouble with their supply chain. I don't know.

column2: Could be plain old hubris. It's an Atlas, the king of the battlefield. The Lyrans expect you to take one look at it, shit yourselves, and run screaming for the hills, so why bother keeping it in full repair?
column3: Could be plain old hubris. It's an Atlas, the king of the battlefield. The Lyrans expect you to take one look at it, shit yourselves, and run screaming for the hills, so why bother keeping it in full repair?

column2: Whatever the rationale, we've got an extremely juicy target right in front of us. With your lance's help, I intend to destroy that target. Deal?
column3: Whatever the rationale, we've got an extremely juicy target right in front of us. With your lance's help, I intend to destroy that target. Deal?

column2: That's what's in our contract, Lieutenant. Let's get it done.
column3: That's what's in our contract, Lieutenant. Let's get it done.

column2: Nice work, Commander. The Lyrans are gonna piss themselves when they find out what happened to their \"scout.\"
column3: Nice work, Commander. The Lyrans are gonna piss themselves when they find out what happened to their "scout."

column2: Oh, they'll be furious. If I know the Lyrans, they'll redirect every Assault 'Mech in a 20-mile radius to come stamp us out. We'll lead them on a merry chase, lure them far away from the front lines, and then double back for your push to break through the siege.
column3: Oh, they'll be furious. If I know the Lyrans, they'll redirect every Assault 'Mech in a 20-mile radius to come stamp us out. We'll lead them on a merry chase, lure them far away from the front lines, and then double back for your push to break through the siege.

column2: Sounds like a plan. If you don't need us anymore, we'll move on to support your sister lance in the Jessup Downs.
column3: Sounds like a plan. If you don't need us anymore, we'll move on to support your sister lance in the Jessup Downs.

column2: Word to the wise, Oliveira: the woman you'll be dealing with is no better than the Lyrans. In some ways, she may be worse. She'll do her best to charm you, but trusting her would be a mistake. Watch your back.
column3: Word to the wise, Oliveira: the woman you'll be dealing with is no better than the Lyrans. In some ways, she may be worse. She'll do her best to charm you, but trusting her would be a mistake. Watch your back.

column2: Thanks for the heads-up. We'll see you again when we regroup at Militia HQ. Oliveira out.
column3: Thanks for the heads-up. We'll see you again when we regroup at Militia HQ. Oliveira out.

column2: Primary targets destroyed Commander.
column3: Primary targets destroyed Commander.

column2: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.
column3: I'm inbound to the LZ Commander.

column2: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} lance has arrived!
column3: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} lance has arrived!

column2: Our Employer has kindly added this group to the contract. If we want to get paid we need to take them out.
column3: Our Employer has kindly added this group to the contract. If we want to get paid we need to take them out.

column2: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} lance has arrived!
column3: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} lance has arrived!

column2: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.
column3: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.

column2: That's the last of 'em! Good job, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Head to the evac point! We'll cover you in case any more hostiles turn up.
column3: That's the last of 'em! Good job, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Head to the evac point! We'll cover you in case any more hostiles turn up.

column2: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.
column3: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: Thanks for the assistance, Commander. We're lifting off.
column3: Thanks for the assistance, Commander. We're lifting off.

column2: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.
column3: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.
column3: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.
column3: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.
column3: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column2: We can't keep fighting like this, Commander. I'm afraid that we're going to have to withdraw. The people of Gauthier are on their own.
column3: We can't keep fighting like this, Commander. I'm afraid that we're going to have to withdraw. The people of Gauthier are on their own.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.
column3: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column3: Heads up Commander, its a hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} lance!

column2: Heads up, Commander! We've got fresh Lyran BattleMechs touching down!
column3: Heads up, Commander! We've got fresh Lyran BattleMechs touching down!

column2: You heard the lady! Weapons hot, MechWarriors—let's light 'em up!
column3: You heard the lady! Weapons hot, MechWarriors—let's light 'em up!

column2: More {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} forces on the field!
column3: More {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} forces on the field!

column3: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.

column2: New contacts on sensors, Commander. These units don't match {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.ShortName} signatures. We've got a new player on the field.

column2: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.
column3: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.

column2: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.
column3: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.

column2: That Atlas must've put in a call for help, Commander. We've got incoming Steiner Drop Pods, payload unknown.
column3: That Atlas must've put in a call for help, Commander. We've got incoming Steiner Drop Pods, payload unknown.

column2: Let them come! We'll take them apart, one by one.
column3: Let them come! We'll take them apart, one by one.

column2: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.
column3: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.

column2: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.
column3: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.

column2: My lance has taken the field, Commander. Let's show these Lyran bastards that they aren't as tough as they think they are.
column3: My lance has taken the field, Commander. Let's show these Lyran bastards that they aren't as tough as they think they are.

column2: Commander, our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} friends have deployed forces to assist in our operation here.
column3: Commander, our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} friends have deployed forces to assist in our operation here.

column2: That's an affirmative, XO Olivera. We will provide support to achieve the primary objective. When it's complete we have orders to proceed to our Evac.
column3: That's an affirmative, XO Olivera. We will provide support to achieve the primary objective. When it's complete we have orders to proceed to our Evac.

column2: Understood Lance leader, glad to have you with us.
column3: Understood Lance leader, glad to have you with us.

column2: We're taking heavy losses, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Another few hits like that, and you're gonna be on your own out here.
column3: We're taking heavy losses, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. Another few hits like that, and you're gonna be on your own out here.

column2: Roger that, Cheval. We'll try to take some of the heat off your lance.
column3: Roger that, Cheval. We'll try to take some of the heat off your lance.

column2: Looks like we have some unexpected support from {TEAM_EMP_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} forces.
column3: Looks like we have some unexpected support from {TEAM_EMP_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} forces.

column2: Glad we could make it to the party Commander. Our orders are to assist in the Primary Objective and once that's done head for Evac.
column3: Glad we could make it to the party Commander. Our orders are to assist in the Primary Objective and once that's done head for Evac.

column2: Copy that lance leader, welcome to the party.
column3: Copy that lance leader, welcome to the party.

column2: We lost Quebec Two Commander.
column3: We lost Quebec Two Commander.

column2: This is Quebec Actual, return fire and check your rear arc!
column3: This is Quebec Actual, return fire and check your rear arc!

column2: These Lyrans are packing too much heat, Commander. Lieutenant Damestroir and her lance have been destroyed.
column3: These Lyrans are packing too much heat, Commander. Lieutenant Damestroir and her lance have been destroyed.

column2: Lady Marina won't be happy about that. Think we ought to pack it in?
column3: Lady Marina won't be happy about that. Think we ought to pack it in?

column2: Our mission was to support Damestroir, and she's been reduced to a smear on the pavement. Yeah, Yang. We're done.
column3: Our mission was to support Damestroir, and she's been reduced to a smear on the pavement. Yeah, Yang. We're done.

column3: Commander, our employer's allied forces have been destroyed.

column2: For your first deployment, you will rendezvous with Azura \"Cheval\" Damestroir of the Mitchel Planetary Militia. She and her lance have been scout-hunting in northern Gauthier's wealthy Museum District, and it appears that they've caught a Lyran scout. Assist her lance in defeating it, then proceed to your next rendezvous point.
column3: For your first deployment, you will rendezvous with Azura "Cheval" Damestroir of the Mitchel Planetary Militia. She and her lance have been scout-hunting in northern Gauthier's wealthy Museum District, and it appears that they've caught a Lyran scout. Assist her lance in defeating it, then proceed to your next rendezvous point.

column2: Siegebreaker II
column3: Siegebreaker II

column2: Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. We've been waiting for you. Welcome to Jessup Downs, the unofficial armpit of Gauthier.
column3: Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. We've been waiting for you. Welcome to Jessup Downs, the unofficial armpit of Gauthier.

column2: For some reason, the Lyrans have seen fit to send one of their heavy patrols in our direction. We could use your help to eliminate it.
column3: For some reason, the Lyrans have seen fit to send one of their heavy patrols in our direction. We could use your help to eliminate it.

column2: We've got your back, Jailbird. See to it that you and your lance have ours.
column3: We've got your back, Jailbird. See to it that you and your lance have ours.

column2: Don't worry, Oliveira. We've been holding our own for a long time now, both on and off the battlefield. We know how to protect one another when it counts.
column3: Don't worry, Oliveira. We've been holding our own for a long time now, both on and off the battlefield. We know how to protect one another when it counts.

column2: That's that, Commander—the patrol's down, and there's nothin' left to fight. You're as skilled as Lady Marina said you'd be.
column3: That's that, Commander—the patrol's down, and there's nothin' left to fight. You're as skilled as Lady Marina said you'd be.

column2: And you're much better than your buddy Cheval led us to believe.
column3: And you're much better than your buddy Cheval led us to believe.

column2: Lady Marina teamed you up with Cheval? Wonderful. Well, I can't say I'm surprised that she warned you about me. She's the reason I was rotting in prison before the Lyrans decided to invade.
column3: Lady Marina teamed you up with Cheval? Wonderful. Well, I can't say I'm surprised that she warned you about me. She's the reason I was rotting in prison before the Lyrans decided to invade.

column2: On what charge?
column3: On what charge?

column2: Conduct unbecoming of an officer. Fraternization—with her husband, if you care about such matters. But the most serious charge was assaulting a fellow officer. For what it's worth, I regret my part in what happened, but that doesn't change the past.
column3: Conduct unbecoming of an officer. Fraternization—with her husband, if you care about such matters. But the most serious charge was assaulting a fellow officer. For what it's worth, I regret my part in what happened, but that doesn't change the past.

column2: The past doesn't matter right now; it's the future that we need to be concerned with. Keep your comms open. Lady Marina will be in contact soon to discuss our next steps.
column3: The past doesn't matter right now; it's the future that we need to be concerned with. Keep your comms open. Lady Marina will be in contact soon to discuss our next steps.

column2: Roger that, Oliveira. Jailbird out.
column3: Roger that, Oliveira. Jailbird out.

column2: Beautiful work, Commander! Scratch one Steiner heavy patrol!
column3: Beautiful work, Commander! Scratch one Steiner heavy patrol!

column2: That's what I like to hear. Meet me at the LZ, and I'll swing the Leopard around to pick you up.
column3: That's what I like to hear. Meet me at the LZ, and I'll swing the Leopard around to pick you up.

column2: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} lance has arrived!
column3: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} lance has arrived!

column2: Our Employer has kindly added this group to the contract. If we want to get paid we need to take them out.
column3: Our Employer has kindly added this group to the contract. If we want to get paid we need to take them out.

column3: The hostile {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} lance has arrived!

column3: Our Employer has offered a bonus if we eliminate this group as well.

column2: Mission successful, Commander. Time to get out of here.
column3: Mission successful, Commander. Time to get out of here.

column2: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.
column3: All our objectives are complete, cover our withdraw, Commander.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: Thanks for the assist, Commander. It's time for us to clear out.
column3: Thanks for the assist, Commander. It's time for us to clear out.

column2: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.
column3: Thanks for the assist, we're clear.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.
column3: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.
column3: That's it Commander, we did what we came here to do. Come on home.

column2: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.
column3: We won't get paid for covering their evac if we leave before them, plan accordingly Commander.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.
column3: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column2: We can't keep fighting like this, Commander. I'm afraid that we're going to have to withdraw. The people of Gauthier are on their own.
column3: We can't keep fighting like this, Commander. I'm afraid that we're going to have to withdraw. The people of Gauthier are on their own.

column2: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.
column3: We're clear of the AO, thanks Commander.

column3: Inbound hostile Dropship detected, drop zone marked.

column2: Uh oh, what's this? Meyer, are you seeing a blip on your sensors?
column3: Uh oh, what's this? Meyer, are you seeing a blip on your sensors?

column2: That's affirmative, Jailbird—I've got incoming Steiner Drop Pods. I'm marking their projected LZ on your screen.
column3: That's affirmative, Jailbird—I've got incoming Steiner Drop Pods. I'm marking their projected LZ on your screen.

column2: I hope you're ready to hurt a few more Lyrans, Commander. I know that I am.
column3: I hope you're ready to hurt a few more Lyrans, Commander. I know that I am.

column2: We're on the field and ready to fight, Commander. You turn their asses our way, and we'll give 'em a nice, hard kick.
column3: We're on the field and ready to fight, Commander. You turn their asses our way, and we'll give 'em a nice, hard kick.

column2: Roger that, Jailbird. Let's take 'em out.
column3: Roger that, Jailbird. Let's take 'em out.

column2: Commander, our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} friends have deployed forces to assist in our operation here.
column3: Commander, our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} friends have deployed forces to assist in our operation here.

column2: That's an affirmative, XO Olivera. We will provide support to achieve the primary objective. When it's complete we have orders to proceed to our Evac.
column3: That's an affirmative, XO Olivera. We will provide support to achieve the primary objective. When it's complete we have orders to proceed to our Evac.

column2: Understood Lance leader, glad to have you with us.
column3: Understood Lance leader, glad to have you with us.

column2: They're hitting us hard, Commander. A few more shots like that, and my lance is history.
column3: They're hitting us hard, Commander. A few more shots like that, and my lance is history.

column2: Hang tight, Jailbird. We'll try to pull them off you.
column3: Hang tight, Jailbird. We'll try to pull them off you.

column2: Looks like we have some unexpected support from {TEAM_EMP_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} forces.
column3: Looks like we have some unexpected support from {TEAM_EMP_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} forces.

column2: Glad we could make it to the party Commander. Our orders are to assist in the Primary Objective and once that's done head for Evac.
column3: Glad we could make it to the party Commander. Our orders are to assist in the Primary Objective and once that's done head for Evac.

column2: Copy that lance leader, welcome to the party.

column2: Copy that lance leader, welcome to the party.

column2: We lost Quebec Two Commander.
column3: We lost Quebec Two Commander.

column2: This is Quebec Actual, return fire and check your rear arc!
column3: This is Quebec Actual, return fire and check your rear arc!

column2: Jailbird is down, Commander. Repeat, Jailbird is down.
column3: Jailbird is down, Commander. Repeat, Jailbird is down.

column2: That's it, then—we're done. I'll get our people ready for evac.
column3: That's it, then—we're done. I'll get our people ready for evac.

column2: Commander, our employer's allied forces have been destroyed.

column2: Your next objective is in Jessup Downs, on the far side of Gauthier. Your point of contact, a former militia member and paroled felon who operates under the callsign \"Jailbird,\" has been holding the Downs with no outside support for nearly a month. She has reported signs of a heavy Steiner patrol lance moving through the area. I need you to assist her in bringing down that patrol.
column3: Your next objective is in Jessup Downs, on the far side of Gauthier. Your point of contact, a former militia member and paroled felon who operates under the callsign "Jailbird," has been holding the Downs with no outside support for nearly a month. She has reported signs of a heavy Steiner patrol lance moving through the area. I need you to assist her in bringing down that patrol.

column2: Siegebreaker III
column3: Siegebreaker III

column2: This is it, Commander—our chance to break the siege. I hope that your people are ready for this, because we may never get another opportunity.
column3: This is it, Commander—our chance to break the siege. I hope that your people are ready for this, because we may never get another opportunity.

column2: We're well aware of the stakes, Cheval. And we know what's facing us. I'm willing to bet that we've gone toe-to-toe with House Steiner far more often than you have, even after more than a month under siege.
column3: We're well aware of the stakes, Cheval. And we know what's facing us. I'm willing to bet that we've gone toe-to-toe with House Steiner far more often than you have, even after more than a month under siege.

column2: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.
column3: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.

column2: I see you, little militiamen. You think to come for me, eh? I salute your courage, but your efforts are doomed to failure. And when my BattleMechs crush you under their feet, I will tighten my grasp around Gauthier. You will surrender what is mine, or your city will starve.
column3: I see you, little militiamen. You think to come for me, eh? I salute your courage, but your efforts are doomed to failure. And when my BattleMechs crush you under their feet, I will tighten my grasp around Gauthier. You will surrender what is mine, or your city will starve.

column2: Your ex isn't \"yours,\" you self-entitled pig. And the only thing I intend to give you today is a death as ignoble as you are.
column3: Your ex isn't "yours," you self-entitled pig. And the only thing I intend to give you today is a death as ignoble as you are.

column2: You've done it, Commander. Dobrescu is dead—and with him, any reason for the Lyrans to continue this siege. On my orders, what remains of the planetary authority will begin receiving and distributing aid to the people of Gauthier immediately.
column3: You've done it, Commander. Dobrescu is dead—and with him, any reason for the Lyrans to continue this siege. On my orders, what remains of the planetary authority will begin receiving and distributing aid to the people of Gauthier immediately.

column2: We'll make it happen, Lady Marina. You have my word.
column3: We'll make it happen, Lady Marina. You have my word.

column2: Very good. Commander, I'll be in touch to debrief you and transfer your payment as soon as Liao authority has been reestablished in Gauthier. Liao out.
column3: Very good. Commander, I'll be in touch to debrief you and transfer your payment as soon as Liao authority has been reestablished in Gauthier. Liao out.

column2: The Ziegelhaus is down, Commander. Repeat, the Ziegelhaus is down.
column3: The Ziegelhaus is down, Commander. Repeat, the Ziegelhaus is down.

column2: And Dobrescu's buried in the rubble. Brilliant work, Commander.
column3: And Dobrescu's buried in the rubble. Brilliant work, Commander.

column2: That's it, people. Our job here is done! Militia HQ is safe, the Ziegelhaus is down, and Hauptmann-General Dobrescu is dead.
column3: That's it, people. Our job here is done! Militia HQ is safe, the Ziegelhaus is down, and Hauptmann-General Dobrescu is dead.

column2: That's what I like to hear! Get our people to the evac zone, and I'll have 'em out of there in no time.
column3: That's what I like to hear! Get our people to the evac zone, and I'll have 'em out of there in no time.

column2: Just keep an eye on the militia buildings until you leave the field. You know, just in case.
column3: Just keep an eye on the militia buildings until you leave the field. You know, just in case.

column2: I don't see any more Steiner units in the AO, Meyer. It looks like we are a go to extract.
column3: I don't see any more Steiner units in the AO, Meyer. It looks like we are a go to extract.

column2: Roger that, XO. Commander, get to the evac zone. I'll be there to pick you up in two shakes.
column3: Roger that, XO. Commander, get to the evac zone. I'll be there to pick you up in two shakes.

column2: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!
column3: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!

column2: We'll have to destroy that lance if we want to complete the mission.
column3: We'll have to destroy that lance if we want to complete the mission.

column2: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!
column3: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!

column2: If we destroy them we'll get a hefty bonus.
column3: If we destroy them we'll get a hefty bonus.

column2: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.
column3: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.

column2: Our employer is saying we NEED to kill those units. Prepare to engage.

column2: Even with a portion of Dobrescu's sentries out chasing shadows in the Museum District, the Ziegelhaus will be heavily defended. You'll need to hit the structure hard, while at the same time protecting Militia HQ from an expected Steiner counterattack. Good hunting, Commander. Show Hauptmann-General Dobrescu that his excesses will not be tolerated.
column3: Even with a portion of Dobrescu's sentries out chasing shadows in the Museum District, the Ziegelhaus will be heavily defended. You'll need to hit the structure hard, while at the same time protecting Militia HQ from an expected Steiner counterattack. Good hunting, Commander. Show Hauptmann-General Dobrescu that his excesses will not be tolerated.

column2: Siegebreaker III
column3: Siegebreaker III

column2: This is it, Commander. There's a gang of big metal bastards between us and Dobrescu, and then we'll have a mountain of steel to get through. But I think we can do it.
column3: This is it, Commander. There's a gang of big metal bastards between us and Dobrescu, and then we'll have a mountain of steel to get through. But I think we can do it.

column2: I'm with you there, Jailbird. But keep your eyes open for Cheval. She made it pretty clear that she had no intention of sitting this fight out.
column3: I'm with you there, Jailbird. But keep your eyes open for Cheval. She made it pretty clear that she had no intention of sitting this fight out.

column2: If she's stupid enough to get between us and our targets, I'll take her out myself. And I'll make certain that she's properly dead this time.
column3: If she's stupid enough to get between us and our targets, I'll take her out myself. And I'll make certain that she's properly dead this time.

column2: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.
column3: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.

column2: I see you, little militiamen. You think to come for me, eh? I salute your courage, but your efforts are doomed to failure. And when my BattleMechs crush you under their feet, I will tighten my grasp around Gauthier. You will surrender what is mine, or your city will starve.
column3: I see you, little militiamen. You think to come for me, eh? I salute your courage, but your efforts are doomed to failure. And when my BattleMechs crush you under their feet, I will tighten my grasp around Gauthier. You will surrender what is mine, or your city will starve.

column2: If you're talking about your ex, she isn't \"yours,\" you Lyran prick. This convict is gonna teach you a lesson about what happens when you try to impose your will on others. I'll give you a hint: it starts with my foot and ends with your ass.
column3: If you're talking about your ex, she isn't "yours," you Lyran prick. This convict is gonna teach you a lesson about what happens when you try to impose your will on others. I'll give you a hint: it starts with my foot and ends with your ass.

column2: You've done it, Commander. Dobrescu is dead—and with him, any reason for the Lyrans to continue this siege. On my orders, what remains of the planetary authority will begin receiving and distributing aid to the people of Gauthier immediately.
column3: You've done it, Commander. Dobrescu is dead—and with him, any reason for the Lyrans to continue this siege. On my orders, what remains of the planetary authority will begin receiving and distributing aid to the people of Gauthier immediately.

column2: I'd like to assist with that, if you'll have me. I await your judgment, Lady Marina; my future is in your hands.
column3: I'd like to assist with that, if you'll have me. I await your judgment, Lady Marina; my future is in your hands.

column2: We'll discuss your legal status soon enough. Commander, I'll be in touch to debrief you and transfer your payment as soon as Liao authority has been reestablished in Gauthier. Liao out.
column3: We'll discuss your legal status soon enough. Commander, I'll be in touch to debrief you and transfer your payment as soon as Liao authority has been reestablished in Gauthier. Liao out.

column2: The Ziegelhaus is down, Commander. Repeat, the Ziegelhaus is down.
column3: The Ziegelhaus is down, Commander. Repeat, the Ziegelhaus is down.

column2: And Dobrescu's buried in the rubble. Brilliant work, Commander.
column3: And Dobrescu's buried in the rubble. Brilliant work, Commander.

column2: That's it, people. Our job here is done! Militia HQ is safe, the Ziegelhaus is down, and Hauptmann-General Dobrescu is dead.
column3: That's it, people. Our job here is done! Militia HQ is safe, the Ziegelhaus is down, and Hauptmann-General Dobrescu is dead.

column2: That's what I like to hear! Get our people to the evac zone, and I'll have 'em out of there in no time.
column3: That's what I like to hear! Get our people to the evac zone, and I'll have 'em out of there in no time.

column2: Just keep an eye on the militia buildings until you leave the field. You know, just in case.
column3: Just keep an eye on the militia buildings until you leave the field. You know, just in case.

column2: Even with a portion of Dobrescu's sentries out chasing shadows in the Museum District, the Ziegelhaus will be heavily defended. You'll need to hit the structure hard, while at the same time protecting Militia HQ from an expected Steiner counterattack. Good hunting, Commander. Show Hauptmann-General Dobrescu that his excesses will not be tolerated.
column3: Even with a portion of Dobrescu's sentries out chasing shadows in the Museum District, the Ziegelhaus will be heavily defended. You'll need to hit the structure hard, while at the same time protecting Militia HQ from an expected Steiner counterattack. Good hunting, Commander. Show Hauptmann-General Dobrescu that his excesses will not be tolerated.

column2: Siegebreaker III
column3: Siegebreaker III

column2: This is it, Commander. I'm picking up a lot of sensor activity around the Ziegelhaus. Our lance is in for a hell of a fight.
column3: This is it, Commander. I'm picking up a lot of sensor activity around the Ziegelhaus. Our lance is in for a hell of a fight.

column2: They can handle it. Our people are professionals, and we can trust them. That puts them a step ahead of Cheval and Jailbird.
column3: They can handle it. Our people are professionals, and we can trust them. That puts them a step ahead of Cheval and Jailbird.

column2: Hold that thought, Commander. We may not be willing to take the field together, but that doesn't mean that we can't help. I'm bringing Militia HQ's northern turrets online.
column3: Hold that thought, Commander. We may not be willing to take the field together, but that doesn't mean that we can't help. I'm bringing Militia HQ's northern turrets online.

column2: And I've got the ones to the south. As long as Jailbird stays on her side of the complex, I'm content to focus my fire on the Lyrans instead of on her.
column3: And I've got the ones to the south. As long as Jailbird stays on her side of the complex, I'm content to focus my fire on the Lyrans instead of on her.

column2: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.
column3: INCOMING TRANSMISSION.

column2: I see you, little militiamen. You think to come for me, eh? I salute your courage, but your efforts are doomed to failure. And when my BattleMechs crush you under their feet, I will tighten my grasp around Gauthier. You will surrender what is mine, or your city will starve.
column3: I see you, little militiamen. You think to come for me, eh? I salute your courage, but your efforts are doomed to failure. And when my BattleMechs crush you under their feet, I will tighten my grasp around Gauthier. You will surrender what is mine, or your city will starve.

column2: Your ex isn't \"yours,\" you Lyran prick. This convict is gonna teach you a lesson about what happens when you try to impose your will on others. I'll give you a hint: it starts with my foot and ends with your ass.
column3: Your ex isn't "yours," you Lyran prick. This convict is gonna teach you a lesson about what happens when you try to impose your will on others. I'll give you a hint: it starts with my foot and ends with your ass.

column2: You've done it, Commander. Dobrescu is dead—and with him, any reason for the Lyrans to continue this siege. On my orders, what remains of the planetary authority will begin receiving and distributing aid to the people of Gauthier immediately.
column3: You've done it, Commander. Dobrescu is dead—and with him, any reason for the Lyrans to continue this siege. On my orders, what remains of the planetary authority will begin receiving and distributing aid to the people of Gauthier immediately.

column2: We'll make it happen, Lady Marina. You have my word.
column3: We'll make it happen, Lady Marina. You have my word.

column2: And mine, if you'll accept my help. I await your judgment, Lady Marina; my future is in your hands.
column3: And mine, if you'll accept my help. I await your judgment, Lady Marina; my future is in your hands.

column2: We'll discuss your legal status soon enough. Commander, I'll be in touch to debrief you and transfer your payment as soon as Liao authority has been reestablished in Gauthier. Liao out.
column3: We'll discuss your legal status soon enough. Commander, I'll be in touch to debrief you and transfer your payment as soon as Liao authority has been reestablished in Gauthier. Liao out.

column2: The Ziegelhaus is down, Commander. Repeat, the Ziegelhaus is down.
column3: The Ziegelhaus is down, Commander. Repeat, the Ziegelhaus is down.

column2: And Dobrescu's buried in the rubble. Brilliant work, Commander.
column3: And Dobrescu's buried in the rubble. Brilliant work, Commander.

column2: That's it, people. Our job here is done! Militia HQ is safe, the Ziegelhaus is down, and Hauptmann-General Dobrescu is dead.
column3: That's it, people. Our job here is done! Militia HQ is safe, the Ziegelhaus is down, and Hauptmann-General Dobrescu is dead.

column2: That's what I like to hear! Get our people to the evac zone, and I'll have 'em out of there in no time.
column3: That's what I like to hear! Get our people to the evac zone, and I'll have 'em out of there in no time.

column2: Just keep an eye on the militia buildings until you leave the field. You know, just in case.
column3: Just keep an eye on the militia buildings until you leave the field. You know, just in case.

column2: I don't see any more Steiner units in the AO, Meyer. It looks like we are a go to extract.
column3: I don't see any more Steiner units in the AO, Meyer. It looks like we are a go to extract.

column2: Roger that, XO. Commander, get to the evac zone. I'll be there to pick you up in two shakes.
column3: Roger that, XO. Commander, get to the evac zone. I'll be there to pick you up in two shakes.

column2: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!
column3: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!

column2: We'll have to destroy that lance if we want to complete the mission.
column3: We'll have to destroy that lance if we want to complete the mission.

column2: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Demonym} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!
column3: Heads up, commander, a lance of {TEAM_HOST.FactionDef.Name} units just entered the area. They're hostile to everyone!

column2: If we destroy them we'll get a hefty bonus.
column3: If we destroy them we'll get a hefty bonus.

column2: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.
column3: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.

column2: Our employer is saying we NEED to kill those units. Prepare to engage.
column3: Our employer is saying we NEED to kill those units. Prepare to engage.

column2: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Demonym} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.
column3: Commander, I'm seeing hostile {TEAM_TAR_ALLY.FactionDef.Name} units in the area. Our target brought in allies for backup.

column2: If we decide to kill these units our employer if offering a bonus.
column3: If we decide to kill these units our employer if offering a bonus.

column2: A lance of hostile {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Demonym} has landed nearby.
column3: A lance of hostile {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} has landed nearby.

column2: Our employer wants us to kill these guys. This mission isn't ending until they die.
column3: Our employer wants us to kill these guys. This mission isn't ending until they die.

column2: A lance of hostile {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Demonym} has landed nearby.
column3: A lance of hostile {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} has landed nearby.

column2: Our employer is offering us some extra cash if we destroy these units too.
column3: Our employer is offering us some extra cash if we destroy these units too.

column2: Scratch another target.
column3: Scratch another target.

column2: We can't keep fighting like this, Commander. I'm afraid that we're going to have to withdraw. The people of Gauthier are on their own.
column3: We can't keep fighting like this, Commander. I'm afraid that we're going to have to withdraw. The people of Gauthier are on their own.

column2: Good job, commander. All primary objectives complete. Get to evac, Sumire will pick you up here.
column3: Good job, commander. All primary objectives complete. Get to evac, Sumire will pick you up here.

column2: Heads up, Commander. We've got another wave of Lyran units entering the AO.
column3: Heads up, Commander. We've got another wave of Lyran units entering the AO.

column2: Our 'Mechs had better pick up the pace. The longer the Ziegelhaus remains standing, the more resistance we're going to have to deal with.
column3: Our 'Mechs had better pick up the pace. The longer the Ziegelhaus remains standing, the more resistance we're going to have to deal with.

column2: Uh oh, Boss. We've got more Steiner reinforcements on the field.
column3: Uh oh, Boss. We've got more Steiner reinforcements on the field.

column2: Gods. Even more Steiner reinforcements just touched down in the AO.
column3: Gods. Even more Steiner reinforcements just touched down in the AO.

column2: Bastards don't know when to quit, do they? Let's light 'em up!
column3: Bastards don't know when to quit, do they? Let's light 'em up!

column2: Watch out commander, more hostiles are arriving. They'll be landing in this area.
column3: Watch out commander, more hostiles are arriving. They'll be landing in this area.

column2: Watch out commander, more hostiles are arriving. They'll be landing in this area.
column3: Watch out commander, more hostiles are arriving. They'll be landing in this area.

column2: Commander, we've got a lance of enemy forces moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} base.
column3: Commander, we've got a lance of enemy forces moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} base.

column2: They're coming in fast, don't let them get too close.
column3: They're coming in fast, don't let them get too close.

column2: Commander, we've got a lance of enemy forces moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} base.
column3: Commander, we've got a lance of enemy forces moving towards the {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} base.

column2: They're coming in fast, don't let them get too close.
column3: They're coming in fast, don't let them get too close.

column2: We've got inbound Lyran reinforcements, Commander.
column3: We've got inbound Lyran reinforcements, Commander.

column2: Heads up, Commander: another Steiner lance has just entered the AO.
column3: Heads up, Commander: another Steiner lance has just entered the AO.

column2: Commander, enemy turrets identified.
column3: Commander, enemy turrets identified.

column2: Look out, Commander. Another wave of Steiner units just appeared on my screen.
column3: Look out, Commander. Another wave of Steiner units just appeared on my screen.

column2: The {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} has provided some of their own forces to support us.
column3: The {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Name} has provided some of their own forces to support us.

column2: They're here to defend their base and will engage any hostiles that get too close.
column3: They're here to defend their base and will engage any hostiles that get too close.

column2: Militia HQ is under attack, Commander. We'd better get somebody over there to protect it.
column3: Militia HQ is under attack, Commander. We'd better get somebody over there to protect it.

column2: We've got Steiner units surrounding the Ziegelhaus, Commander. They're taking up position to repel our advance.
column3: We've got Steiner units surrounding the Ziegelhaus, Commander. They're taking up position to repel our advance.

column2: We can't finish this while those hostiles are still standing. Take 'em out.
column3: We can't finish this while those hostiles are still standing. Take 'em out.

column2: Commander, I'm seeing hostile defenders surrounding the enemy base.
column3: Commander, I'm seeing hostile defenders surrounding the enemy base.

column2: Structure down, Commander! Press on, and that whole fortification is history!
column3: Structure down, Commander! Press on, and that whole fortification is history!

column2: A friendly structure is taking damage, Commander. We may need to allocate more resources to protecting Militia HQ.
column3: A friendly structure is taking damage, Commander. We may need to allocate more resources to protecting Militia HQ.

column2: Militia HQ just lost a stucture, Commander. We'd better make a priority of protecting the rest.
column3: Militia HQ just lost a stucture, Commander. We'd better make a priority of protecting the rest.

column2: Militia HQ is almost completely destroyed, Commander. If we lose it, we're done here.
column3: Militia HQ is almost completely destroyed, Commander. If we lose it, we're done here.

column2: We're going it alone on this one, so we shouldn't have any infighting to worry about. That's a good thing, because we're gonna be outnumbered enough as it is.
column3: We're going it alone on this one, so we shouldn't have any infighting to worry about. That's a good thing, because we're gonna be outnumbered enough as it is.

column2: Even with a portion of Dobrescu's sentries out chasing shadows in the Museum District, the Ziegelhaus will be heavily defended. You'll need to hit the structure hard, while at the same time protecting Militia HQ from an expected Steiner counterattack. Good hunting, Commander. Show Hauptmann-General Dobrescu that his excesses will not be tolerated.
column3: Even with a portion of Dobrescu's sentries out chasing shadows in the Museum District, the Ziegelhaus will be heavily defended. You'll need to hit the structure hard, while at the same time protecting Militia HQ from an expected Steiner counterattack. Good hunting, Commander. Show Hauptmann-General Dobrescu that his excesses will not be tolerated.

column2: Succession
column3: Succession

column2: We're getting an incoming transmission, Commander. Looks like our target has something to say.
column3: We're getting an incoming transmission, Commander. Looks like our target has something to say.

column2: Attention, incoming mercenaries. I am Commander Yuetu of the Red Hare Irregulars, and you are encroaching on my company's territory. Turn back or be destroyed.
column3: Attention, incoming mercenaries. I am Commander Yuetu of the Red Hare Irregulars, and you are encroaching on my company's territory. Turn back or be destroyed.

column2: Well, she sounds confident.
column3: Well, she sounds confident.

column2: For good reason. I've got more than a hundred enemy kills under my belt. If you don't want to join them, I suggest that you turn tail and run.
column3: For good reason. I've got more than a hundred enemy kills under my belt. If you don't want to join them, I suggest that you turn tail and run.

column2: It isn't gonna be easy to catch up with Yuetu's ejection pod, Commander. There's already a whole swarm of Red Hare BattleMechs converging on her location.
column3: It isn't gonna be easy to catch up with Yuetu's ejection pod, Commander. There's already a whole swarm of Red Hare BattleMechs converging on her location.

column2: I underestimated you, Commander. You're much better than the last assassin my mother sent after me.
column3: I underestimated you, Commander. You're much better than the last assassin my mother sent after me.

column2: Wait. Your mother?
column3: Wait. Your mother?

column2: She didn't tell you? I suppose I'm not surprised. If you'll grant me the courtesy of a parley, I'll tell you what you've gotten yourself dragged into.
column3: She didn't tell you? I suppose I'm not surprised. If you'll grant me the courtesy of a parley, I'll tell you what you've gotten yourself dragged into.

column2: It's over, Commander—you've lost. But I am not without sympathy. As a courtesy, I'll allow you to pick up the pieces of your lance as you go.
column3: It's over, Commander—you've lost. But I am not without sympathy. As a courtesy, I'll allow you to pick up the pieces of your lance as you go.

column2: Target down, Commander.  A nice, clean kill.
column3: Target down, Commander. A nice, clean kill.

column2: Not quite. I'm picking up an ejection pod on my sensors. Looks like Yuetu managed to punch out.
column3: Not quite. I'm picking up an ejection pod on my sensors. Looks like Yuetu managed to punch out.

column2: Of course she did. Wouldn't be a real deployment if things didn't go to hell at least once.
column3: Of course she did. Wouldn't be a real deployment if things didn't go to hell at least once.

column2: We still may be able to catch up with her ejection pod if you hurry.
column3: We still may be able to catch up with her ejection pod if you hurry.

column2: Readings indicate the ambushing units are out of commission. The employer will be pleased.
column3: Readings indicate the ambushing units are out of commission. The employer will be pleased.

column2: That is our target, sustain fire on that unit!
column3: That is our target, sustain fire on that unit!

column2: Sensors are showing enemy movement beyond our initial count. Be advised you might meet with increased resistance.
column3: Sensors are showing enemy movement beyond our initial count. Be advised you might meet with increased resistance.

column2: Commander, the target is bugging out! Eliminate them before they escape.
column3: Commander, the target is bugging out! Eliminate them before they escape.

column2: When Lady Helen gives Yamaguchi what he wants, we get paid. Let's get to it, Commander.
column3: When Lady Helen gives Yamaguchi what he wants, we get paid. Let's get to it, Commander.

column2: The secondary objective to destroy an additional lance supporting the assassination target.
column3: The secondary objective to destroy an additional lance supporting the assassination target.

column3: Destroy Red Hare Irregular Mercenaries

column3: Armor Breached

column2: Commander Yuetu and her Red Hare Irregulars have proven an intolerable threat to my interests and to the future of House Khulan. I need you to hunt her down and destroy her BattleMech, an \"Orion,\" I believe it's called. Smash it to pieces and bring me proof of Yuetu's death, and I will lend Shugo Yamaguchi my support.
column3: Commander Yuetu and her Red Hare Irregulars have proven an intolerable threat to my interests and to the future of House Khulan. I need you to hunt her down and destroy her BattleMech, an "Orion," I believe it's called. Smash it to pieces and bring me proof of Yuetu's death, and I will lend Shugo Yamaguchi my support.

column2: Succession II
column3: Succession II

column2: I'm setting you down at Yuetu's last known coordinates, Commander. She should be close.
column3: I'm setting you down at Yuetu's last known coordinates, Commander. She should be close.

column2: I'm here, Meyer. And I'm ready to make you regret ever setting foot on Primus. You're just the latest in a long line of my brother's hired killers. You wanna know what happened to them?
column3: I'm here, Meyer. And I'm ready to make you regret ever setting foot on Primus. You're just the latest in a long line of my brother's hired killers. You wanna know what happened to them?

column2: Nothing we need to worry about. C'mon, Yuetu, we both know how it worked out the last time you fought us.
column3: Nothing we need to worry about. C'mon, Yuetu, we both know how it worked out the last time you fought us.

column2: You may kill me today, Mr. Virtanen; you're certainly capable of it. But I promise you that if you do, I'll go down with your throat between my teeth. I'm fighting for my family's future, and I have nothing left to lose.
column3: You may kill me today, Mr. Virtanen; you're certainly capable of it. But I promise you that if you do, I'll go down with your throat between my teeth. I'm fighting for my family's future, and I have nothing left to lose.

column2: That's it, Commander. Yuetu is dead. Let's return to Yamaguchi so we can get the hell out of here.
column3: That's it, Commander. Yuetu is dead. Let's return to Yamaguchi so we can get the hell out of here.

column2: We've already proven that we can beat the Red Hare Irregulars, but it's pretty clear that Yuetu wants this more than we do. We're done here.
column3: We've already proven that we can beat the Red Hare Irregulars, but it's pretty clear that Yuetu wants this more than we do. We're done here.

column2: Yuetu is down, Commander. Now let's clear out of here before her allies can return the favor.
column3: Yuetu is down, Commander. Now let's clear out of here before her allies can return the favor.

column2: Readings indicate the ambushing units are out of commission. The employer will be pleased.
column3: Readings indicate the ambushing units are out of commission. The employer will be pleased.

column3: That is our target, sustain fire on that unit!

column3: Commander, the target is bugging out! Eliminate them before they escape.

column2: We promised Shugo Yamaguchi we'd do this. May as well get it over with.
column3: We promised Shugo Yamaguchi we'd do this. May as well get it over with.
